title: Burning Man Ultramarathon
description:
Come join in the ultimate running event - a fatass of an ultramarathon. If you can't run the whole thing, pace and help a runner out. If you can't run, help out at the aid stations. If you can't help out for long, just pour some water or offers shots to runners as they pass.

More info here:
https://sites.google.com/site/burningmanultramarathon/

https://www.facebook.com/events/134927106606461/

Bring a gallon of water, running snack to share, & handheld and prepare to run your heart out!

Stop by Camp Twin Bikini for more info inc the course!
print_description: Fancy running 50 kilometers (31 miles) around the playa? Or just want to volunteer? Get the ultimate high-runners high! If you see a runner, high 5 em

title: Burning Nerds Mixer
description: Join the nerds of Burning Man to celebrate the Census, on-playa research and a love of the brain. Nerds of all types welcome.
print_description: Join the nerds of Burning Man to celebrate the Census, on-playa research and a love of the brain. Nerds of all types welcome.

title: Burning Nerds Mixer
description: Every year the Burning Nerds gather to talk research, policy, and the future of deep thought at Black Rock City.  Join us this year at Ashram Galactica, the finest hotel in Black Rock City, where we will build a 15 foot Ivory Tower that represents our academic aspirations. Built from scrap lumber and constructed by nerds, we will then burn the tower at the end of the mixer.  Join us for the construction and the destruction. And email us if you want to help.
print_description: Join the Nerds: meet researchers, talk theory and build something. This year we will construct a 15 foot Ivory Tower that we will burn at event's end

title: burn the boop
description: yes it all over did you dance the night away still no sleep?then burn the boop b4 u sleep during sunrise ,get there early and help prepare for fire......did u get some sleep? then wake up u lazy bugger and help us burn this baby ....plse hang around and help us clean up     some of us are volunteers who stay and breakdown all the infrastructure and have alot to do for the next 5 days or so....so plse help us get rid of the boopzone so we can help elsewhere....booop boooooop fankyou for all your wonderfull love over the week and plse plse plse do not spend all day monday in your car.....mentally challenged people do this,people who have displaced relationships with how they engaged with the default werld have to do this,do not do it you r crazy ....wait for exodus to finish and go home tuesday ,,,,,,,hanf out with us and do some mooping...see u tomorrow...

title: Burn Wall Street - Keynote Speakers
description: At 9am every day (Mon-Fri) we will ring the bell at the NYSE and give the floor over to a Keynote speaker. The Keynote speaker will express their point of view and what solutions and actions they think should be made. We have a Constitutional Lawyer on Monday, Rev.Billy (Occupy) on Wednesday and Otto Von Danger on Friday before the burn prep.

print_description: Don't miss the Burning of Wall Street....this will be the biggest best fire show you've ever seen. Don't miss it!!!

title: Burn with the Goddess Ravenna Ravine
description:
The Goddess Ravenna Ravine calls all those drawn to Her, to Camp Conception in the early twilight Wednesday. 

Bring your noisemakers, shake your money makers, burner garb, Faerie drag or radical undress, it's all good. Anything Snake especially encouraged. Gay Straight Female Male and every shade in between invited. 

We are the Phoenix Rising from the Flame and Ash sparking new Life every where we land no matter how briefly. We are RIPE with Fertility! We breathe and whole new universes pop out with every exhale! Conception is the place, The Goddess Ravenna Ravine is Her Name and She is Calling YOU! 

We will collect in the late afternoon, adorn ourselves and each other, have a small ritual gather and build energy for Her walk. At 6pm we promenade to the esplanade and playa dispensing Miracles, Blessings and photo pops. The Goddess will be joined by her sister Gina, the Witch. 

When the Goddess is done having Her Way with the Burning Man, She shall return to Camp Conception and release everyone onto their own Journeys. 

Burn with the Goddess!
print_description: Walk and burn with the Goddess Ravenna Ravine! The Goddess and her sister Gina the Witch will be dispensing Blessings and Chaotic Miracles as they go.

title: BYOC Hydration Station
description: Thirsty?  Weary while wandering the BRC?  Is your bottle/cup empty? Come Hydrate from our booze-free jugs of tasty and varied beverages and sit awhile.  Just Remember to Bring Your Own Cup!
print_description: Is your bottle/cup empty? Come Fill it and Hydrate from our booze-free jugs of tasty and varied beverages and sit awhile.  Until Supplies Last.

title: Byron J. Howes
description: Original americana songs that encourage and entertain, spanning blues, rock,  jazz, & folk influences.
print_description: Original americana songs that encourage and entertain, spanning blues, rock,  jazz, & folk influences.

title: By Women for Women Bondage Rides
description: Learn to fly! Explore the unique experience of being bound in rope and suspended in mid-air. Our crew of expert female riggers can give you a ride that is relaxing, beautiful, thrilling, sexy, or excruciating. Suspended Animation restricts photography, drugs, and alcohol. Prefer your suspension experience in a women only environment?  This event is for you! All female identified women welcome.
print_description: Our expert lady riggers will bind you in rope and suspend you in mid air; it can be lovely, erotic, or a thrill. All female identified gals welcome!

title: Café Hippocampus
description: After 8 years of running our in-camp morning Café, we will take our service mobile with our bus. Tuesday and Wednesday we'll still be on site. But once the bus is all built and permitted, find us in deep Playa. We'll be hosting sunrises, sunsets, and midnight Café somewhere next to the temple, or the man, or at the trash fence.
print_description: Visit our Parisian Café for pretentious chat and fabulous couture - if you can find us. The Café is where our bus is.

title: Cafe Kona
description: Wake up and smell the rich aromas of 100% Kona coffee, latte, and espresso, freshly ground and brewed daily for a bit of playa decadence. Learn about what it's like to grow coffee, how to "cup" coffee (did you know there's a flavor wheel for coffee, just as there is for wine and beer?) and a bit about the culture of Hawaii Nei. Listen to soft Hawaiian music and watch the City arise from its slumbers-or head home for a nap.
print_description: Serving 100% Kona coffee and espresso freshly ground and brewed. Listen to soft Hawaiian music, learn about growing coffee, and watch the City awaken.

title: Caipirinha Cataclysm @ Center Camp! Friday, 2:30-4
description:
Join us for the seventh anniversary of the Caipirinha Cataclysm @ Center Camp!

The Caipirinha is the national beverage of Brazil and also an important element of the Brazilian Carnaval celebration—an important historical precedent to Burning Man.

Just look for the Brazilian Flag, the big cooler and the drunk people at Center Camp. Also, keep an eye out for a burly man in a Brazilian banana hammock.

If you want to help out, we're looking for people to bring the following:

Limes
Lime juice
Ice
Clear plastic/lexan glasses (any shape, bonus points for style)
Vodka
Cachaça
White sugar
Straws
Any large brazil paraphernalia

See you soon!
print_description: Join us for the seventh anniversary of the Caipirinha Cataclysm @ Center Camp!
other_location: Center Camp, look for the Brazilian Flag

title: Camera-Free Friday
description: Today, leave your camera in its bag. Be present in the moment. See beautiful things without trying to capture them. Keep only the unmediated memory.
print_description: Today, leave your camera in its bag. Be present in the moment. See beautiful things without trying to capture them. Keep only the unmediated memory.

title: Camp LaLa: Heckling Haberdashery Happy Hour
description:
Come by Camp LaLa's Heckling Haberdashery... Where you will be heckled (of course) over happy hour cocktails served by our camp dandies and dandiettes.  Beats brought to you by PORKCHOP and DJ INXS.


What is a haberdashery, you ask?  It's a fine gentlemen's clothier.  Often times, a hat shop. Or according to the Urban Dictionary...
haberdashery:(n.) Foolish and absurd shenanigans often committed in a social setting. Alcoholic beverages are a popular catalyst to the occurrence of such foolishness. 


COME ONE, COME ALL, COME WEARING A HAT, COME DONNING A MUSTACHE!
print_description: Come by Camp LaLa's Heckling Haberdashery...Where you will be heckled (of course) over happy hour cocktails served by our camp dandies and dandiettes.

title: Camp Toga Party!

Fellow Roman burners!

Come one! Come all!

Drink wine, eat grapes!

title: Camp ZaZen's Doors Whiskey Bar
description: Camp ZaZen will be opening our saloon doors for our first annual Doors Whiskey Bar.. Entranced by the surreal lyrics of Mr. Mojo Risin, take a journey with us to another dimension and expand your mind.. Doors tune will be pumpin (with the ever so brilliant "Alabama Song" opening our festivities) and whiskey will be flowin.. So grab your snake skin pants, lose your shirt, and take a heap of peyote for this adventure..

title: Canada Day Party
description: It's official. Wednesday is Canada Day on the Playa at theme camp Destiny, Oasis. DJs Timothy Wisdom and Funkhunters spin from 2-5pm in the world famous Mo-rockin' tent. Come meet fellow Canadian Burners and drink a real Canadian cocktail - Bloody Caesar's will be served. Everyone welcome.

title: Canning & Preserving
description: How can you enjoy seasonal veggies and fruits all year long without importing them from across the world?  Learn about preserving through canning. It’s  low energy, chemical free and uses recyclable glass. Vicki will share recipes and ideas.
print_description: Learn about preserving through canning, low energy, chemical free, recyclable glass. Vicki will share recipes and ideas.

title: Capoeira!
description: What is Capoeira? A Brazilian Martial art that embodies a historical legacy that cried for freedom. Today it is a unique blend of music, folklore, acrobatics & fitness. This event will present an introduction to capoeira history, music & technique. The physical workshop will be geared primarily towards beginners (Thursday there will be a more advanced workshop), followed by an open roda. Newcomers and students of all levels are welcome to participate and practice this beautiful fight in a dance and a dance in a fight.
print_description: What is Capoeira? A Brazilian Martial art blending music, folklore, acrobatics & fitness in the embodiment of a historical legacy that cried 4 freedom

title: Career Ending Footage
description:
Sick of your crummy job but too pussy to quit? Come over and get caught
in a range of compromising situations in the Camp Career Ending Footage office.

Caught spanking the cleaning lady? Stealing trade secrets? Stroking
the CEO’s underwear? Whatever your indiscretion, we guarantee it’ll be
caught on camera – and we’ll have you jobless in minutes. You’re fired!

title: Cartoon Commune’s Sixth Anniversary Dance
description: Our 6th Anniversary Gala continues as you enjoy those oldies but goodies music from the 60’s along with light refreshments and beyond. Bring your own cup to enjoy your pleasure with. Bring a friend to make it friendly. Mix plenty of fun with a fertile evening of rock and roll dancing and good conversation as you meet new friends and old. Guess what else? A wide open dance contest just for the fun of it.

title: Cartoon Commune’s Sixth Anniversary Party Gala

Guess what else? A few surprises to add plenty of smiles.  Do you smell endorphins in the air? Come for the Gala; stay for the Dance!

title: Cartooning Workshop
description: Cartoons are a powerful way to make people laugh, or express opinions and feelings.  We know you wanna know how it’s done! And there’s much more to it than just “reproduce this!” We can help you grow and hone your fertile sense of humor. Anyone can do this!  We welcome all levels of skill; you do not need to have any prior training or experience.  Learn all the basic skills like character creation, layout, composition, perspective, and writing. Then take your talent to the next level or even to climactic heights beyond! Brush up on advanced techniques like human and animal figure drawing, proportion, and color.  We end with an improvisational art game using the cartooning skills we've learned. Bring your own sharp pencil or handle one of ours. We’ll also provide the clean sheets (of paper) for you to perfect your best work.
print_description: Yes! You can cartoon! All skill levels are welcome. We know you wanna know how it’s done! Learn basic/advanced techniques, & climactic heights beyond!

title: Chef Badger Presents: PRIMORDIAL SOUP
description: The Playa’s hottest new (and perhaps only) restaurant is PRIMORDIAL SOUP. Brought to you by Chef Badger and the Astropups Gastro Squad, this one-night-only event will transport you way, WAY back to a time when flavor wasn’t just a string of chemical compounds but rather a visceral experience. After years of trials in kitchens both on and off Playa, Chef Badger intends to satisfy your curiosity, your belly and perhaps even your soul with his scintillating offerings. Join fellow Burners amidst moody cave-like interiors alongside our open kitchen as your mouth encounters flavors as fertile as a budding Earth. Seating begins at 10:00 (first come/first served) or stop by the Proto-Bar for cocktails and nosh.
print_description: The Playa’s hottest new restaurant is PRIMORDIAL SOUP. Moody cave-like interiors await as your mouth encounters flavors as fertile as a budding Earth.

The Chicago style veggie dog is said to be "dragged through the garden" due to the many toppings.

title: Christmas in Paradise
description:
It’s that most wonderful time of the year, Christmas! We invite all Naughty and Nice boys and girls to come celebrate this most blessed time with us. It’s the holiday season minus the conservative family, midnight mass, and your ugly aunt’s Christmas sweaters (Well, maybe a sweater or two, but that’s a choice).  
We promise music to dance to, drinks to be merry (and gay) with, mistletoe to kiss under and a sexy Santa handing out gifts! 
Come see which list you were put on when we watched you sleeping, punishments and presents will be given accordingly.  Happy Holidays!

title: Climate Change: The State of the Science
description: Passionate about the planet but fuzzy on the science? Learn from a scientist about the causes, effects, and mitigation strategies for climate change. This class will help you to understand the scale and importance of climate change and what you as an individual can do to make a real difference.  We will discuss the science of long-wave radiation and the impact of gases such as carbon dioxide on Earth's radiative balance, the sources, sinks, and scales of carbon dioxide on Earth, and potential strategies for mitigating climate change through reduced CO2 emissions through renewable energies such as wind and solar and by geoengineering schemes such as geologic carbon capture and sequestration, terraforming, and oceanic iron seeding.
print_description: Passionate about the planet but fuzzy on the science? Learn from a scientist about the causes, effects, and mitigation strategies for climate change.

title: Coffee with Advice Ladies
description:
Start your morning (or walk of shame home from last night) with some hot, dusty coffee and some... well, interesting yet profound advice from the oldest, wisest, and, perhaps, drunkest ladies on the Playa.

title: Compassionate Spank Workshop
description: Have you ever been interested in spanking, but aren't so into pain?  Want to know how to take your partner to the next erotic level, but aren't into all the "gear"? We will focus on bare-hand technique, with only minimal involvement of spanking tools.  No males admitted without partner.

title: Compassion Meditation and Mind Training
description: Learn how to use breath, focus, and meditation to build compassion for yourself and others (even people you don't like!). Develop a Compassionate Image as a future tool for yourself, and get a sense of how you could use the Compassionate Mind Training process in your daily life. This is an experiential workshop. We'll debrief at the end but it will mainly be a guided meditation session and no direct teaching.

title: Conversations in Kundalini Yoga Therapy
description:
Ever wondered whether there was any western scientific research to back up some of the claims that Yoga makes? What about Kundalini Yoga, how much do we really know from a empirical perspective about the mechanics of how Kundalini Shakti affects the mind and body? 

What many Kundalini Yoginis know from their own practice is actually beginning to emerge into the annals of Academic research and we are going to spend an afternoon diving right into Yoga as Medicine for Kundalini practitioners. 

The emergence of Kundalini Yoga in the world of Yoga Therapy is beginning to flower, join me as I help facilitate a lovely time on the playa for those who are interested in the quantum healing field of Kundalini.

title: Cosmic Creativity with Alex Grey
description:
Cosmic Creativity
An illustrated talk with Alex Grey and Allyson Grey
Thursday, August 30th
7-9pm 
@ Area 51's Chapel of Sacred Mirrors
7:00 and Esplanade

God is the divine artist and the universe is the continually evolving masterpiece of creation.  -- Alex Grey

Creativity is an evolving cosmic force, the spark that activates inspired action. Realization and alignment with our source activates and empowers our channels of cosmic creativity. Pyramids, ancient stone circles, and temples were all built by armies of creators in alignment with heaven and earth. Uniting with the nature-field expands the identity of the individual beyond the bounds of body and ego, realizing the cosmic Self in Oneness with Collective Consciousness. The unitive mystical experience is the basis of all religions. Explore visionary culture through the lens of cosmic creativity and consider how the aesthetic experience of art can be a magnifying glass through which we appreciate life.

title: Costume Gifting/ Recycling
description:
Kostume Kult has been "Costuming the Naked" since 2002 with donations from costume companies, theater groups and burners like you who help us recycle their old costumes and freaky fashions. Here we empower people with new attitude to be birthed down our runway, with the encouragement of our MCs and DJs, onto the Esplanade and into their new lives.

The rules are simple. 
 
1. The stuff is free.  No returns or barter required although we do encourage recycling old costumes through us. 

2. You must wear what you want to take with you.  We are not giving "product" but "experience" and transformation is what is being offered-- not a consumerist feeding frenzy. (Decommodification)
 
3.  If you have found something truly wonderful that makes your heart go pitter-patter... Consider giving it to the person next to you.  Generosity trumps the accumulation of stuff. (Gifting)

4.  If you are looking for something specific, coming in with an agenda, you will not find it.  We aint got it. (and we might actually hide it from you! ;) Come in with an open mind to mix and match and be silly (Immediacy).

4.  Donated costumes can be moopy.  Please help us keep the playa perfect and consciously dispose of all tags, loose threads and packaging. (Leave No Trace)

5. Go forth onto the playa ready to participate and express yourself more fully.  Costume is the mix of fashion and theater and the playa is one big-ass stage.  After our runway, be prepared to make new connections in your new costumed persona or upgraded burner attitude.  (Participation and Radical Self Expression)
print_description: Kostume Kult: Costume gifting & recycling.  Gifting thousands of pounds of free stuff & a great place to recycle unloved costumes. Afternoons Tues-Fri
other_location: 2:45 & Esp - Kostume Kult in Nyrvana Village

title: Creativity and the Chakras
description: Do you think creativity is an aptitude of people more fortunate than you? Do you desire to be more creative but feel stuck? Do you have lots of creative ideas but have trouble bringing any of them to any fruition? Do you jump from one creative project to the next without any sensing any unifying thread? Drawing upon Vajrayana (Tantric) Buddhism, Jungian psychology, Neurolinguistic Programming, and an experiential journey through the 7 chakras, this interactive talk will explore the nature of creativity and its obstacles, and use those obstacles as catalysts to uncover your innate capacity to create.

title: CRITICAL DICKS!!!
description:
The Critical Dicks March began as a male response to the glorious annual Critical Tits bike ride, which of course is a take-off on the famous Critical Mass bike ride, which in turn is a pun on the nuclear physics term for the amount of a radioactive substance required to begin spontaneous nuclear fission, which was discovered by a bunch of scientists like Albert Einstein, who, for the most part had DICKS. (OK, Marie Curie was a notable exception, but she was HOT. Talk about a nuclear family!) So ya see, what comes around, goes around. 

The Critical Dicks March welcomes all genders: Male, Female, Transsexual, Intersexual, Pansexual, Gay, Bi, Straight, and Bent. However, if you are not naturally blessed with a dick, please bring a long a reasonable fucsimile. 

And now, let the testosterone flow! Stand proud and erect as you march through the streets of Black Rock City! Cast of the cruel duds of oppression! You have nothing to lose but your shame!

The Critical Dicks March has a long history, and is best pulled off in protest fashion, so now is the time to stand up tall and demand equal rights for your Dick!!!

title: Critical Tits Topless Bike Ride
description:
Critical Tits- topless bike procession has been a life-changing tradition since 1996 and is an unforgettable high-point of the week for all women who want to have the experience of being celebrated as Goddesses,Sisters, Mothers, Daughters,or female members of the human race. The critical mass is thousands of women who proudly ride in this procession to create a wave of joy for themselves, each other, and the respectful bystanders who cheer them on their way.Please consider the privacy of the riders in this huge parade when tempted to take photos or videos without the women's permission.
Celebrate your creativity with artful decorations,glitter,paint,be yourself to the max! Fertility is the perfect theme to participate in this joyful event, or come out to the parade route and cheer the Goddesses on! 
An unforgettable, life-changing ritual is planned at the end of the ride, don't miss it. 

History of Critical Tits:
The ride started in 1996 on a day when the Critical Mass ride was taking place in San Francisco. Five of us painted our chests, got on our bikes and rode through BRC shouting “Critical Tits.” Women joined us and men bowed down. Each year since then the ride has more or less doubled in size. We had 5000+ riders in previous years.

Obviously something about the experience resonates with women. We are the largest gathering of women on the playa, and for many of us, the experience offers a meaningful connection to the power of female energy within ourselves and within our playa community.

Q: When is the ride?

A: The ride starts at 4 pm on Friday at the Man. Please respect the fact that the ride is for women and girls only.

Q: What happens at the end of the ride?

A: Each year, the ride ends in a different manner. The end-of-ride event is meant as an opportunity for women to connect with and celebrate each other.
print_description: Celebrate feminine glory while bonding with your tribal sisters, be welcomed & loved!17 year BM tradition,5000+ decorated,joyful,confidant women.

title: Dance as Communication (an interactive lesson)
description:
Self expression is cool: flailing, head banging and stochastic gyration is all good fun. But communication is hard if our self expression is not understood. This class aims to cut to the chase and help you build your own vocabulary that reflects you, while imposing as little orthodox structure on your creativity as possible. Where most dance lessons focus on the vocabulary of dance, in this class you will have the opportunity to explore the phonemes of dance. These are the small bits that can be assembled into dance moves, just like we assemble phonemes into words that can be understood by others. Understanding these concepts renders the need to distinguish between one style/vocabulary and another far less important and makes the fusion of many styles and techniques much, much easier. It's like being able to read the phonetic alphabet, or seeing the green lines of binary code behind the Matrix. 

So here's how it works: We're going to start off with a half an hour or so of these kinetic phonemes (little bits) and we're going to splice in some practice dances to solidify the concepts. Then your teachers are going to to DJ a set using some of the music you've practiced with and employing a playlist designed to illustrate how the social dances can be adapted to a wide variety of cool stuff. So cool in fact, that you will probably want to write down and download when you get home. (or you will experience a rush of feel-good chemicals because you're already familiar with such cool music and that will make you feel cool even though your self-perception is an illusion of your temporal brain chemistry.) During this dance, you may ask your teachers and any other veteran social dancers who may be attending for advice and technique. There won't be any dance etiquette at play here and the next scheduled dance that follows may well be in the nude, so relax, get over yourself and let's have fun.
print_description: Learn to communicate dancewise via the fundamental kinetic concepts underlying the social dances like tango, swing, blues. Exotic playlist.

title: Dance of Liberation
description:
Native American tradition, blindfold dance, global music, hands on healing: powerful soul work to shed inhibitions and heighten inner awareness.

Join us on this unforgettable tribal SOUL journey as we create a ritual celebration that fuses dance and contemporary shamanism. This unique form of movement therapy heals and frees physical, mental, emotional and spiritual blockages, blurring the lines between club culture, dance, music and internal exploration by tuning in to sound, movement, and the trance-like journey of self-discovery and self-realization! This mystical, inspirational and fun process modernizes ancient shamanic journeying techniques of drumming and the ritualistic use of the blindfold. With the Shamanic safe space set and a personal intention declared, you blindfold yourself to enter an individual experience of self-expression and inner awakening. The music brings you into yourself and encourages you to explore the unknown, the darkness where we transcend into deeper states of consciousness - where there is freedom to scream, cry, meditate, dance and everything in between -  with the available assistance of the leader and the gatekeepers. Throughout the dance, the leader may apply energetic healing by intuitively approaching dancers, but without the use of touch. Eventually the music brings us back home here on earth, and dancers relax upon the ground to receive hands on healing. Side by side, though in our own inner world, through this journey we each are given the chance to experiencing our sacred "Vision Quest". We dance our intention and seek to better understand our Soul's purpose. 

First-time gatekeepers encouraged to volunteer to help keep dancers safe during the dance - this is generally done energetically, though light touch may be used if necessary. All our welcome on this journey, however, you must be on time. This is  a respectful, safe and sacred event.
print_description: Native American tradition, blindfold dance, global music, hands on healing: powerful soul work to shed inhibitions and heighten inner awareness.

Utilizing dance, contemporary shamanism, hands on healing, drumming and live DJ, this powerful and beautiful soul work sheds inhibitions and heightens inner awareness in a safe and carefully monitored group setting. Dancers are blindfolded in the shamanic tradition and step beyond their conscious fears and limitations and allow their innermost creative sides to break free. Dancers tune in to sound and movement to take an inner journey exploring a trancelike state of self-discovery and self-realization.

title: Dancing Freedom
description: Dancing Freedom is an ecstatic practice of liberation. It is a somatic and shamanic dance practice supporting our remembering of who we really are as unique individuals part of a global interconnected family. It is enlivening, engaging, profound, ecstatic and empowering. It heals, reveals and welcomes everyone that wants to show up. Any person can do it. When we come together we come in peace to create a sacred space of shared transformation.The experiences are supported by a world/trance music wave.

title: Dancing Freedom: Birthing The New Paradigm
description:
In this shamanic, somatic dance ceremony, we will dance with the process of birthing the new paradigm, from the seeds of conception to gestation to the contractions that arise along the way to actualization. Every part is necessary for the creation of the world we are ushering in. We will dance an elemental wave through earth, water, fire, air and ether to heal, transform & embody our most highly empowered selves, allowing us to more actively engage with this rapidly shifting world from a centered, grounded place. 

Dancing Freedom is a practice of liberation and embodied awakening. It is a somatic, ecstatic and shamanic dance practice supporting the emergence of living oneness. It is fun, easy, elegant and empowering. It heals. It reveals. It welcomes. Any person of any age, size, color or creed can do it. When we come together we come in peace to create a deep space of shared practice, transformation and community. We come together in ceremony to dance an elemental wave through earth, water, fire, air and ether to heal, transform & embody our awakening.
print_description: Dancing Freedom: Birthing The New Paradigm

title: Dancing Freedom: Ecstatic Alchemy
description: Dancing Freedom is a practice of liberation and embodied awakening. It is a somatic, ecstatic and shamanic dance practice supporting the emergence of living oneness. It is fun, engaging and empowering. It heals. It reveals. It welcomes. When we come together we come in peace to create a deep space of shared practice, transformation and community. We gather in ceremony to dance an elemental wave through earth, water, fire, air and ether to reclaim, transform & express the totality of who and what we are. The five Elements are the building blocks of our world as well as alchemical keys to the mystery of divine co-creation.  In learning to attune to the elements we can harmonise the inner and outer dimensions of our experience and open to the depths and mystery of the sacred dance of life. As we invoke these primordial forces, they awaken the dreamer within who can assist us to create a deeper relationship to our Selves, others and our environment.  Engaging our body, mind and emotions within the relational field is an active and imaginative process that opens the gateways of consciousness for real-time remembrance of our multi dimensional wholeness and unity.
print_description: Empower your body and soul in this somatic, shamanic and ecstatic dance practice that supports the emergence of embodied awakening, oneness and JOY.

description: Dancing Freedom is a somatic, ecstatic and shamanic dance practice supporting the emergence of living oneness and what it truly means to be embodied. We shall provide the space for you to dive deeper in to your dance and to develop an intimate relationship with each of the 5 elements. Earth, Water, Fire, Air and Ether are the building blocks of the created Universe through which we EMBODY. As we work with and through each element they gift us with full spectrum expression and experience, full spectrum transformation and full spectrum return to wholeness. By having an experiential understanding of how these elements work within us, we gain tools that help us to move through life and all of its lessons in a more centered and conscious manner. When we come together we come in peace to create a deep space of shared practice, transformation and community.

Located in the Illumilodie Lazer Dome @ Silicon Village

His articles have appeared in The New York Times Magazine, Esquire, Wired, The Village Voice, LA Weekly, ArtForum, Arthur, and many other publications. title: Dark Side of the Rainbow Showing
description:
We have put together one of the best Dark Side of the Moon/ Wizard of Oz mashups you will ever see.  
We researched and experimented with many albums to complete the movie.  Be sure to stay to The End for 
one of the most perfect synchronizations in the entire movie!

synchronize: To cause (soundtrack and action) to match exactly in a film.
synchronicity: Coincidence of events that seem to be meaningfully related, 
conceived in Jungian theory as an explanatory principle on the same order as causality.

This mashup is a sublime example of synchronization and synchroncity.  

Synchronicity bewteen albums and movies is relatively easy to find. Often times the mood of a musical
piece can be flexible enough to fit with many scenes in a movie.  But in this case, the mood of 
the various Pink Floyd albums across the course of the scenes in The Wizard of Oz seem to synchronize 
with the mood of the movie perfectly.

Synchronization is more difficult to find between an album and a movie. Of course you can adjust the start
point of a movie to create artificial synchronizations but you would not necessarily expect many other
components to align.   However, in this mashup you find absolutely amazing synchronized scenes.  At the risk
of spoiling some surprises ... be sure to pay attention to the music and in particular the timing of the silences 
after Dorothy's house lands in Oz.  Also, pay attention to the ends of songs and note how more often than not
the song ends align with scene ends.  The synchronizations is so tight it makes you wonder how this could ever be 
conicidence.  Was this designed by Pink Floyd?  All band members vehemently deny this.

We will have some seating available but you also might want to consider bringing a chair/blanket/pillow.

The movie will start at 8:30PM (after sunset when full dark has set in.)
print_description: Dark Side of the Moon/Wizard of Oz. Could be the best version you will ever see.  Albums added to complete the movie. A MUST see for Floyd fans.

title: Dark Sparkle Burlesque show
description: Dark Sparkle is the potent mix of the mysterious and the dangerous that makes something irresistibly attractive. It's what pushes people to the point of insanity; that unexplainable quality that pulls people to the dark side. Some days, Dark Sparkle is your alter-ego; other days it is your most natural feeling form. Dark Sparkle is Mona Lisa's smile, biscuits and gravy, the Fonz, the apocalypse. It is an adventurous way of life--physically, emotionally and mentally that citizens of BRC embrace. Our shows are an opportunity for Dark Sparklers and other BRC citizens to explore and showcase their Dark Sparkle through performance, storytelling, and tease. Featuring Nicki Sparxx! Father Figure! Roxy Pop! La Chispa! Red Siren! StraighNasty! and many more. We'll also turn the tables with ample opportunity for participation.
print_description: Bringing you sass, sparkle and an exploration of the mysterious and dangerous that is Dark Sparkle, featuring the DS crew and other BRC citizens.

title: Dead on the Playa!
description:
The second annual Grateful Dead Listening Party kicks off Tuesday & Thursday afternoon.  We dig deep into the hive collective and produce such gems as: The Monkey and the Engineer" from the old Letterman Show, Grateful Dead sing the "National Anthem" for the SF Giants in the early 90's and my personal favorite, "Promised Land" from the Sunshine Creamery and Dairy Concert in 1972!  No duds & no repeats like last year!!  Although I won't be sober, I have it arranged that a semi-sentient being will start the music on time!  Our trusty old favorite, tasty Ritz Crackers will be served.
You're on your own for cocktails although we usually bend the knee and pour a few for old friends as we spy them.  Also on the scene- our World Map that you can sign to make your attendance mark for all to see. Also our Playa famous gift tree, chock-a-block full of useful survival items.
print_description: Come join us for the Second Annual Grateful Dead Listening Party at Camp Pendant.  Nobody rocks the Playa like the Dead! Tasty Ritz Crackers on scene.

Come listen to our jealousy experts as they hold forth on how to get over or at least sneak past jealousy.

title: Developing Local and Global Water Ethic
description: What is water ethic? What does it mean to be connected to water? the land? each other? What are our responsibilities to keeping water clean and ensuring ample resources for all denominations of society? What are some strategies for engaging people in discussing and finding solutions for water quality and quantity issues? What role does spirituality play in terms of appreciating water and human behaviour towards water and environmental stewardship? We will explore and discuss these questions and more together. There will be examples presented from different places around the world (Singapore, San Antonio, TX, Bangladesh, etc...). We will then break out into groups to brainstorm what a local water ethic would look like in your watershed and prepare a fun pamphlet to educate and attract local citizens to join in the movement.
print_description: Developing Local and Global Water Ethic: Connecting people to natural resources through spirituality and education

title: Dex Mex
description: It began four years ago as a tiny camp party celebrating home-grown breaks DJ Dex Stakker.  Dex Mex (¡Olé!) has since grown to include world-class DJ talent—and perhaps more importantly, margaritas.  It has been heralded by many as “the best daytime party all week”.  Sure, that could have been the tequila talking, but tequila knows a good party, so you should listen when it speaks.  Bring your sombrero, dancing shoes, and a cup and join the conga line from camp out to the party on the playa.  If you miss the train, swing by camp for the exact location of the event.  Look for the Center of Attention Chair, take a seat, be adored, then come join us for some daytime dancing fun.

title: Dixon's Violin
description: Dixon's life mission is to inspire people! Recently giving up a distinguished career to follow this dream full-time, he shows the beauty of doing something seemingly impossible, and bares his soul through his instrument in a captivating one-man show unlike anything you've experienced. Dixon was classically trained from the age of 10, grew to a symphony violinist, then digital master, and now music shaman. Currently touring the U.S. and beyond, Dixon has mesmerized crowds from Burning Man to TEDx, as well as radio and TV. Dixon's passionate energy will enchant, transform, and inspire you.

title: DIY Nifty Storage Solutions
description: "Stuff", the bane and boon of many  DIYers and Burners lives.  We see treasure where others see garbage (and vice versa) but where and how the heck do we store the gewgaws and doodads that we think might be useful someday? Karen and Tammie facilitate a group get together to show off their ideas on storage solutions and to hear about (or even see!) yours. A little demonstration will begin the workshop followed by a show and tell (or just tell) from workshop participants on their storage solutions.
print_description: Where to put DIYers and Burners doodads and gewgaws? Some ideas presented followed by show and tell from you. Come to share or hear storage solutions.

Wear your best camouflage, BDUs, 13-button pants if you like.  Or not.  Soldier? Sailor? Marine? Airman? Come live your "in the service" fantasy or re-live those manly military days from your past.  From foxholes to flight decks, barracks to bulkheads it’s all here, men! Remember, what happens at Burning Man stays at Burning Man...

title: Dont Buy that Product!

Brenda and Kim will show you how to make your own awesome toothpaste, deodorant,lotion,soap, garden sprays, cleaners.  We'll all come away empowered to not buy a product in a store when we could more easily, simply and cheaply make a better product at home.  The workshop includes making your own deodorant and toothpowder. Bring a small seal-able container (2 to 4 oz).

After the two minute Flash-dance, we invite you fresh live beEts by DJ Drone and to enjoy honey sweetened peppermint mate and lemon flavored ice water in our sweet lil speakbeezy.  

One award daily to best HoneyBee.  >'='<
Bee the change!

description: Come join us for a light heart-ed exploration of Qigong, an ancient book of wisdom written in the language of movement.  You'll discover that you have all the resources you need to keep your body healthy and your mind at peace, using these simple, yet profound movements.  Jump, tap, shake, sway, and breath yourself into a state of tranquility & health.  There will be an emphasis on practical application; this is a workshop and group movement meditation, not a lecture! All are welcome, especially beginners.

title: Dragon Smelter Coin Minting
description: There is only one place on The Playa, one place on Earth where money is free: at the Dragon Smelter's Coin Minting Love-in, where trash, in the form discarded aluminum cans and scrap aluminum (previously-formed into bars) are punched into blanks used to press a Dragon Smelter design onto a coin you will keep forever.  Kids love it!!  Always a huge demand for these coins.  Plan on showing up early before a line forms.  Your Dragon Smelter team will help you knock out your own coins until they run out of aluminum, are too tired to move and actually break the press used to exert the tonnage needed to impress the coins.
print_description: MINT YOUR OWN COINS USING OUR 50-TON PRESS!!  That's more force than a semi-trailer standing on it's nose!!  Your forever Fertility keepsake is free!

title: Dr. Sketchy's Anti Art School BRC
description:
Dr. Sketchy's Anti-Art school is the world's premier alt.drawing movement. pARTicipants draw glamorous playa models and enjoy performers in an atmosphere of boozy conviviality while being ferried around by art cars. 

We're bringing the anti-art "happening" with an international cadre of 6 Models, 2 Art Cars, Prizes, a Celebrity judge, an electro baroque Songstress, a ton of donated art supplies, stocked bar w/Bartender, and it's going to be ever so much FUN!! 

Found in 2005 in a dive bar in Brooklyn, Dr. Sketchy's has now spread to over 100 cities around the world now including BRC.  If you are a member of an existing Dr. Sketchy chapter come represent, if you don't know what we're talking about find out!  Be part of the founding of the Black Rock City's chapter of Dr. Sketchy's.
print_description: BRC's the newest chapter of this global underground art movement.  Bring your own art supplies or use ours.  Models, performers, and art cars provided

This experience of music making offers an opportunity for expression and reflection that unites our bodies, minds and spirits through the rhythm of the Drum. title: Ecstatically Birthing Ourselves into Being
description: Amber Alchemy shares how birth is occurring continuously in a variety of forms and at various scales~ whether it’s birthing a child or project or our selves anew in each moment. We are designed to be living conduits of fundamental creative energy streaming forth and manifesting into form.  The question is, how much are we impeding or allowing these vital currents to move and dance their way through us in each moment?  When we dissolve the inevitable veneers accumulated from our societal conditioning, we find at the core an inherently ecstatic nature.  Often touched upon inconsistently in fleeting moments of unification, it beckons us forth as a song calling us home.  Discover how to get out of your own way, dissolving resistance and accessing this essential core in order to ecstatically birth the fullness of each moment from a state of pure presence.
print_description: Amber Alchemy helps us discover how to access our inherently ecstatic nature as we allow the creative currents to move and dance through us.

title: Ego, Entheogens, and the Akashic Field
description: Presented by James Oroc.  This workshop builds on the discoveries and theories on a quantum role for the entheogenic experience that I presented in my book "Tryptamine Palace: 5-MeO-DMT and the Sonoran Desert Toad", by integrating ancient and modern ideas on the role of the Ego in consciousness. We will examine how entheogen use can cast a light on some of the most ancient and perplexing questions of the role of the Ego in our lives; and how the Ego creates our Society and technology, and how our modern view of the role of the Ego - in both our lives and our Society - will shape the future we will all live.

title: Electric Parade
description:
Attention bikers, pedestrians, stilt walkers, zombies, bunnies and electric vehicles alike.
 
Meet at the Man Thursday at 1630h if you’re ready to join "CO2 Green Drive" and show how to get from A to B in style using human and renewable energy powered transportation solutions.
 
Yes. We want all you electric people to show your colors and join us when we complete a CO2 shaped route on the open playa starting from the Man. With the help of a smartphone Application all can be part of a GPS CO2 shaped "tag" as we parade our way through Black Rock City. Essentially, we will all be live brushes, smartphone technology the paint and Black Rock City our playground and canvass.
 
And if you prefer to enjoy your Burning Man experience off-line there is no need to download the APP. Just hop along and join the parade.

The concept stems from the experimental Art, Climate & Technology Project “CO2 Green Drive”. The CO2 Green Drive Project was devised in connection with the UN Climate Summit COP15 in Copenhagen/December 2009. Since 2009 the project has been performed 23 times in 19 cities on five continents "tagging" these with citywide CO2 "paintings". In April 2012 the project was performed simultaneously in 12 cities on five continents.

Using art and culture as a universal language CO2 Green Drive seeks to promote a sustainable and fertile future in all its aspects. It's time art shows the way via physically engaging, playfull and fun activities supporting abundant life everywhere. 
 
Around the world this has included bikers and skaters in Dakar, electric vehicles in New York and runners in India. Next Stop Nevada.
 
At Burning Man we hope to see lots of bikes, tri-bikes- quadro-bikes, pedestrians, stilt walkers, bunnies, things we don't even know how to name and electric art cars ... and, well, perhaps with a couple of zombies thrown in. As long as your mode of transportation is based on renewable technology we can’t wait to ROCK the dust with you.
print_description: Calling all pedestrians, bikers, stilt walkers and electric MVs. Join us when we CO2 GPS "tag" BRC and demonstrate how to get from A to B in style.

title: Encore Show: 48 Hour Film Project BRCity 2012
description: If you couldn't make it to the (On the Red Carpet) Premiere Show on Thursday, August 30th at 11 PM of the 48 Hour Film Project or are jonesin' for another Playa Videogasm adventure, come to the Friday Encore Show to see the results of the Black Rock City 48 Hour Film Project! Each of these movies was made in 48 hours on the Playa. "Cinderplaya" features a wizard searching for his playa love. "Portaman" discovers a mastermind's plan to destroy Burningman. "Sister Lucy" helps burners learn about sex. During "Abandon All Hope and Fear", a dream teaches the way of the playa. More movies will be included. The 48 Hour Film Project's mission is to advance filmmaking and promote filmmakers. Through its festivals the Project encourages filmmakers and would-be filmmakers to get out there and make movies. The tight deadline of 48 hours puts the focus squarely on the filmmakers—emphasizing creativity and teamwork skills. While the time limit places an unusual restriction on the filmmakers, it is also liberating by putting an emphasis on "doing" instead of "talking." At Videogasm in Snowflake Village at 8:15 & Edelweiss. Bring your own chair or tarp. Note, to join the BRC 48 Hour Film Project to help make a film, come to the kick-off at Videogasm on Tuesday, August 28th between 3-5 PM.
print_description: Come see the results of the Black Rock City 48 Hour Film Project! Each of these movies was made in 48 hours on the Playa.

title: Erotic Massage for Men & their Lovers
description:
This workshop, now in its 8th year on the playa, is an ultra-condensed form of a type of massage developed by the Body Electric School. It combines breathwork and a sequence of erotic massage techniques which stimulate erotic energy but don’t expend it in ejaculation. The result is often a heightened erotic state some people call a “full body orgasm,” which can go on for many minutes and can lead to all kinds of ecstasies, insights, and even spiritual experiences.  

Here are a few guiding principles if you’re thinking of coming to the workshop (more at http://playajoy.org/?p=2758#more-2758):

- Yes, participants get naked and give/receive erotic, genital massage.  So, this is only open to adults, and only participants – no spectators.

- Givers of massage may be of any sex, receivers must have a penis. (One of the most powerful parts of this workshop is how gay, straight, & everyone else share erotic space together.)

- You can come with a partner or try your luck at the workshop. Usually, about a dozen people come partnerless to each workshop.

- There is no contact between participants other than the massage. This isn’t group sex (not that there's anything wrong with that!) Boundaries are maintained and respected. We even ask that givers not look around the room — receivers can feel it when you’re not tuned in.

- Bring water, a towel and WetOnes for optimal pleasure. Pee ahead of time. Some people like to be blindfolded – bring a bandana or blindfold if you like.  Bring breath mints to gift to others!

- Last year we had a line around the block a full hour before the workshop started. So, come early!

- Unfortunately, we don’t have time to do two full workshops, so you’ll either give or receive, but not both. Both are hot!

See you on the playa!
print_description: Breathwork & erotic massage for men & their lovers, as taught by Body Electric. Hands on, clothes off, full body orgasm! Adult participants only.

title: Eyeland Oasis
description:
An Eyedyllic retreat for soothing astonished eyes and dust weary feet.  We will provide a sanctuary to relax in, while your peepers and your creepers are being attended to by "doctors" without orders.
The goal of Eyeland Oasis is to provide a tranquil oasis for fellow Burners to receive soothing care for their red, dusty eyes (organic chilled cucumber slices on the eyelids, chilled gel eye masks, herbal/saline eyedrops for self-application) and for their weary, under-appreciated feet (foot bath with a vinegar formula, massage and moisturizer application), while relaxing in reclining chairs or futons, listening to soft ambient music and wind chimes, and drinking lemon-slice-infused chilled water.  We will have an aesthetic and luxurious "spa" inside a 30' diameter shade tent with attractive/flowing fabrics and carpets and creative, entertaining graphics designed by several of our professional artist campmates.  We will be able to accommodate up to 6 "patients" at a time and will have 4 attendants on site during the afternoon hours. We will also gift eye cups decorated with an Eyeland Oasis/BMan logo.  We plan to bring 2, 55-gallon water containers, and will build an appro!
priate gray water/evap area.
To soften borders, open hearts, open arms and open eyes.
Enjoy the creativity of others' minds.
As adults, to remind people how to be playful.
To see and appreciate imagination become reality.
To continue to influence the macrocosm and microcosm of our worlds thru the BMan experience with our creativity and life choices throughout the year.
print_description: An Eyedyllic retreat for soothing astonished eyes and dust weary feet.  We will provide a sanctuary for your relaxation.

title: Eye of RA Party at Osiris Village
description:
OSIRIS VILLAGE and BLACK ROCK SYNDICATE PRESENT:::EYE OF RA THURSDAY

In ancient times, Egyptians believed all forms of life were believed to have been created by RA, the Sun God, who called each of them into existence by speaking their secret names. Humans were created from RA's tears and sweat.

The Egyptians often referred to the sun and the moon as the "eye"s of particular gods. RA's right eye was equated with the sun, and his left eye equated with the moon.

The Eye of RA therefore, can also take the form of a goddess: the mother who brings RA forth. RA was sometimes said to enter the body of the sky goddess at sunset, impregnating her and setting the stage for his rebirth at sunrise.

In the spirit of Fertility 2.0, we must pay homage to RA at night with the moon in full, before he is born again at dawn Friday morning.

Egyptian attire is requested for our evening Eye of Ra party. Come as Cleopatra, Marc Anthony, Pharaoh, or any of your favorite Ancient Egyptian Gods and Goddesses to prove your dedication to Ra and be protected until eternity. 

8 PM Sophie Rae 
9 PM Jonny Quest 
10 PM Just J 
11 PM Jefr Tale and Str!pe 
12 AM Myagi 
1 AM Dylan Rhymes 
2 AM Donald Glaude 
3 AM Hatiras 
4 AM The Scumfrog 
5 AM Brian Williams 
6 AM Dustin Sheridan 

And your dedication to RA by displaying your Egyptian attire will not go unnoticed, as the Eye of RA sees all. Please find the arm of RA, a Pharaoh by the name of Cameron and he will reward you with a playa gift amulet that would make RA himself jealous. 

I now bid you safe passage on your way from the default world to our underworld.
print_description:
OSIRIS Village and BLACK ROCK SYNDICATE PRESENT:::

EYE OF RA THURSDAY

title: French Maid Brigade Parade
description:
Due to the extra traffic of our bourgeoning population pouring into the playa, the dust is expected to be much worse this year, so much so that they’re calling it Futility 2.0. Even the Black Rock Rangers have faltered as their ranks have questioned their resolve in the face of such a menace. They need not fear, for The French Maid Brigade will once again provide their services gratis to the community of Black Rock City. Once again our citizens can rest assured that they will be protected from any and all dusty intrusions. 

Each year one or two rookie French Maids spend extra time addressing the situation with the Rangers only to realize, “Wait, they actually dress to look like dust!” Indeed, if you could magnify a dust particle five billion times, you would see the likeness of a Black Rock Ranger. Clearly the Rangers have succumbed to the mentality of “If you can’t beat ‘em, join ‘em." The French Maids have no such intentions with dust, will never surrender, and continue to support the radical self-expression of all who dwell on the playa through maintaining a dust-free environment for all who participate.

Many enquiries are made every year as to how one might join such a venerable organization. You too can be one of the sexiest clean freaks on the playa. Stop by our camp anytime for official recruitment or rendezvous with us on the playa. Please bring: non-feather dusters, rags, dustbusters, service carts, vacuums, white gloves, latex gloves, enema kits, lube, any other useful cleaning equipment, and your worst possible French accent. On Thursday at 2:00 pm we meet at 3 O’Clock and Esplanade then dust our way through every filthy, nasty camp on our march toward that dust bucket known as Center Camp Café, liberate them from their dusty oppression, and celebrate our triumph!
print_description: Dust abatement doesn't have to be Futility 2.0. Join us in uniform with your non-feather duster and your worst possible French accent.

title: French Mod Happy Hour
description: Are you more Gainsbourg or Hallyday? Deneuve or Bardot? Get your Mod on and join us for musique, cocktails and bonhomie.  We provide the drinks, you bring your own certaine je ne sais quoi.

title: French Quarter Wine Education and Tasting
description:
Black Rock Vineyard and Wine Cellar provide wine tasting, education and subterranean, climate controlled wine storage. The Playa isn't the place to stash your fine wine. What? you're gonna keep it in your trunk?!? That gets up to 195˚ in the afternoon! That's no place for wine. Bring those bottles to us. We'll send them down our dumbwaiter to our wine caves where they'll be kept at the perfect temperature until you need them.
Dumbwaiter hours to send bottles down or retrieve them from the caves are 10:00 to 2:00. 
Throughout the day, we'll be hosting tastings. Check the board out front for tasting schedules. We'll have Sommeliers available to assist you with food pairing, wine selection with hints and tips on how to get the most from our wine tasting classes. If you're an intimidated newcomer to wine, we're the place for you.
print_description: Wineaux Wednesday Vino eVent. The Black Rock Vineyard & Wine Cellar will be hosting a beginners wine tasting class. 3:00 Wednesday @ 7:30 and A. We ID

We will ck to see if you are old enough, if you are not, we will have juice for you.The Gypsy Witches are here for you! Newbies & lone travelers. Our camp consists of experienced Burners who would like to provide a community for you to camp/explore with(drug free), so if you are a first-time Burner, a lone traveler or are just looking for a welcoming group to spend a week with, you are welcome to join us!

title: Full Moon Fire Dance
description: Fire dancing has been a part of many historic cultures in the world. Come join us relive this tradition at the desert lake bed under the full moon. Whether you are emulating the ancient Aztecs dedicating your dance to Xiuhtecuhtli, the god of fire or get into a Balinese trance ritual called the sanghyang, performed to ward off witches, or simply explore primal experiences of dancing with fire; let's come together create an energizing and uplifting experience under the auspicious cosmic alignment.  Drumming and tribal sounds encouraged - bring your drum and musical instruments along.
print_description: Come participate in a fire spin jam under the full moon.  Fire it up and get in the flow.  All props and skill levels welcome.

title: Fun with Fermentation Workshop
description:
I am excited to share the knowledge and artistry of eating and living an Activated lifestyle.  This will be my sixth burn, and fourth year teaching and sharing my passion and love for Fermentation.  Each year we have had a huge turnout, so come early to get a good seat, and bring something to sit on if you can.    

In this workshop I will share background, history, benefits, and instructions for how you can incorporate fermented and activated foods into your life.  
There will also be a variety of fermented food & drink samples to stimulate your palate, and awaken your body to the magic of these healing foods.  

After the workshop is over, everyone is invited to stay and share a variety of fermented foods and drinks.  Participants are encouraged to bring items to share with others.
print_description: 4th year back by popular demand: Learn, taste, and get activated by this fun workshop focusing on the ancient art of fermentation. Followed by potluck

title: Future WOW!
description: Global Futurist David Houle, one of the foremost futurist thinkers  in the world today, will speak about humanity's future through the lenses of communications, connectivity, media, art, religion, and the coming new evolutionary  consciousness.

title: Fuzzy Cuddle Party
description:
At the Ultimate Fuzzy Celebration camp we LOVE cuddling.

We love it so much that we built a "cuddling oasis" - a space where one can take a break, chill, relax, and snuggle - with loved ones or complete strangers - at all times of day or night.

Dubbed the Cuddle Dome, our cuddling space offers a plethora of implements to maximize you comfort and cuddling awesomeness.

Cuddling awesomeness, say you? Who wouldn't want to cuddle suspended 10 feet in the air under the starry Playa sky? (yes, we have a Sky Loft)

And of course we have pillows and blankets. Lots of 'em!

---------------------
Wear your comfiest outfit - fur if you have - and join us for some relaxation, nurture, and affectionate touch before you hit the nighttime playa tonight.
print_description: Love to cuddle? Wear your comfiest (furry!) outfit and join us for some relaxation and affectionate touch before you hit the nighttime playa tonight.

title: Gabriel Gilmore
description:
The Journey - Life Cycle Evolution
The first blurry ebbs & flows of life in protective space, growing with the beat of our initial life source. Painfully but beautifully, our space transforms & we enter the world. A tremendous, grounding grandeur marks our arrival & the rhythm of life begins. As we seek expression, understanding & movement, we drift in an emotional but transient phase & succumb to the flow of life. Eventually we discover our 'voice' & finding contentment in the language of music, our simultaneous sameness & uniqueness is revealed. Seeking transcendence, we push the boundaries of experience, towards the inevitable & incredible transformation which marks the often sombre, but ultimately celebratory end/beginning.
print_description: The Journey - Life Cycle Evolution: The first blurry ebbs & flows of life in protective space, growing with the beat of our initial life source.

title: Gastronomae Dominae
description: An alchemical food and drink spot, Gastronomae Dominae will feature molecular gastronomy, and magic, often indistinguishable. Stop by and taste ritualistically constructed gastronomical feats of food and drink that will tease and taunt your tongue. This low key lounge with hookah, incense, cool drinks, and lots of pillows to lay on is a retreat from the heat of the day, a place to stop by and relax, and try something new. Come experience a sense of haven, and distance from the world around us, using unique textures and tastes to transport yourself to a new world.
print_description: Molecular gastronomy, hookah, absinthe, and lounging in the shade!  Oh, and spicy snow cones.  Because we can!

title: Gay Meet & Greet
description: Black Rock City's LGBT community kicks off the week in festive rainbow colors with libations, music and an exchange of info on the week's gay-oriented events. This premier annual gathering for the Playa's Gay/Bi/Curious Burners and their friends moves to Down Low Club Camp @ 7:45 Edelweiss this year in memory of Mario Cisneros, founder of the event and the former Moonbow Camp. Come meet new friends, reaquaint with those from past Burns, perhaps spark a new Playa romance or rekindle one from the past. Gather with your LGBT brothers and sisters to learn where they are camped and what events they've got planned for the week on the Playa. Don't forget to bring a flyer or other info about your gay-oriented events to post on our LGBT Community Bulletin Board.
print_description: Hosted by Down Low Club @ 7:45 Edelweiss, BRC's LGBT community kicks off the week w/libations, music & info exchange on the week's gay-oriented events

title: Gay Pride Parade
description: Starts at the Man.  Spanning every spectrum of age, race, socio-economic backround, political affiliation, religion, ethnicity and national origin, Black Rock City's Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer and Questioning community celebrate their diversity, tolerance and rainbow pride in Burning Man's 2012 Gay Pride Parade.  In remembrance of this annual event's founder, Mario Cisneros 1966-2012.  Parade concludes at Burner Buddies @ 4:20 Jasmine with a post-parade festival
print_description: Black Rock City's Lesbian, Gay, Bi, Trans & Queer community & friends celebrate rainbow pride/diversity in 2012's Gay Pride Parade. Starts at the Man.

title: Geek n Greet
description:
Burning Geeks.  

This is the official info on this years Playa-side Geek-n-Greet.   

All Burning Geeks are invited to join us in celebrating your year round hard work keeping our interwebs interwebbable!

If you've been rock-starring it across our virtual highways or orbiting events from a cloaked vessel, please come and join us for a stark ravingly fun evening!

WHEN? 
WEDNESDAY, starting at 7ish

WHERE? 
EGGS bar 2012 at 1:30 on the Inner Circle

WHO? 
Web Team, SysAdmin Team, Year-round-Staff Geeks, Playa Wifi Team, BRC Staff Geeks and Friends!

SOUNDS? 
Our very own Kevin aka Dwell will be backing us up with a themed mix! And probably others... 

THEME? 
TBD, and no, the theme is not TBD. The theme is still to be decided. 

WHAT? 
Cocktails and geek speak and more.

LOVE FROM THE PLAYA AND THANK YOU FOR MAKING IT HAPPEN!
print_description: Official Burning Geeks schmooze-n-booze celebrating all things techy. All BM tech folx come together in un-virtual face to face real time interfacing.

title: Geo Dust II Daily Hides
description:
FIVE DAILY CACHES

Tuesday thru Saturday (8/28 - 9/1):

1) Daily hides - an ammo box hidden in a different location each day; removed by 7pm.
2) Daily coordinates will be posted streetside at the Geo Dust II Theme Camp information board each morning by 8am.
3) Geo Dust Theme Camp location - A banner and electronic posting will be at the info booth at Center Camp announcing our exact coordinates.
4) Five new "First to Find" prizes for each day.
print_description: Geocachers can find one of these 5 hides, sign the log, and count it under event #GC3CWXW.  Coordinates available daily @ 8am at Geo Dust II Camp.

title: GeoDust II Gift Exchange & Martini Happy Hour
description:
Geocaching is back in Black Rock City for 2012!  This is an official Geocaching event to add to your log.  A Geocaching poster will be hanging in the Info area near Center Camp announcing the exact waypoints of Geo Dust II Headquarters.  

In order to get credit for this cache, you must participate in the gift exchange/martini happy hour or post a picture of yourself next to any one of the daily hides (See Repeating Events).  

What to Bring:

1) micro/small-sized wrapped exchange gift, value = sentimental (suggestion: piece of Burning Man/BRC swag from a prior year or Geocaching swag)
2) your best martini-drinking vessel
3) food to share (optional)
4) bacon (just kidding...okay, maybe not)
print_description:
Official Geocaching event to log. Bring: 
1) BRC/Geocache swag to trade 
2) martini-drinking vessel
3) food/bacon (if u choose)
4) stories to tell

description: Would you like to be more fully present, conscious, and in the flow? Do you ever feel stuck, blocked, or taken over by your emotions? title: "Global Soul" Throwdown: Africa/Caribbean
description:
"Global Soul" is bringing the higher vibe to Sacred Spaces Village every night, Tuesday-Friday, from 7-10 p.m.!  Featuring a groovalicious fusion of rhythms, harmonies, melodies, movement and magic inspired by cultures from around the world, Global Soul is a soul-stirring, hip-shaking and heart-opening musical feast! 

First, join Soul Songstress Janis Kelly, Percussion Priestess Cheri Shanti and Dance Diva Ahva Lenay, as they move you, groove you and behoove you to bring your inner musician out to play!  Then, get ready for LIVE funk, r&b, jazz, reggae, Salsa, samba, Afro-pop/soul, and other world-infused dance music guaranteed to invite, incite and ignite your own global soul experience!

-WEDNESDAY NIGHT: Africa/Caribbean including Afrobeat, Afro-Pop, High Life and Reggae.  7-7:30--Global Soul "Jam" with Janis, Cheri & Ahva; 7:30-8:00--Global Soul Experience LIVE; 8:00-10:00--Issy Wise & Friends LIVE
print_description: "Global Soul" is a nightly, groovalicious throw-down of LIVE music, movement and magic from around the world! Let us invite/incite/ignite your night!

title: GOAT SLAPPING
description:
The goat will burn. You will drink from its udders and be purified. Don't forget to slap the goat.

Only certain VIPs welcome and respected. Prerequisites exist. A return or an exchange for something of equal value is needed (recommended $40-$80 at gate). Our commercial sponsorship is via Krug.  The shaman priest rabbi pastor determines the content of the collaborating group; no self expression allowed. We strive to produce, promote and protect the Bumblepuss, Nectar community as the antithesis of Burning Man.  We value civil society; not the individual.  If you come, you cannot participate.  You can only observe unless you helped build it, and still, it is still unlikely you will be allowed to participate in the ceremony.  VIP tables with goat buckeyes, goat cheese spread, goat innards, and prime seating are $1200 per table (bring binoculars and a sniper rifle).  (Reservations are a necessity).
print_description: The goat will burn. You will drink from its udders and be purified. Don't forget to slap the goat. Reservations are a necessity. Bring staff + poi.

title: Golden Cafe 10th Anniversary
description: No kidding - 2012 really is the 10TH YEAR of the Golden Cafe on playa!To celebrate, there will be a party all day and all night. You heard right, the Golden Cafe, the most quaint little daytime bar at Burning Man, will be open for one solid night, with all that entails...fire spinning...black light...glowing drinks...mutant vehicles...live bands...DJs...stilt walkers...burlesque...dancing in the streets...We aim to make it EPIC and CRAZY, the way Burners partied back in 2003, and WE NEED YOUR HELP. From Wednesday morning to Thursday morning, wave after wave of camps are invited to join the bedlam wearing their colors, for a special appropriate treat. Let us know how you want to participate and what we can do to lend a hand - we're up for whatever it takes to make the event so ridiculous that it parts the heavens...www.goldencafe.org
print_description: 2012 really is the 10TH YEAR of the swankest cocktail lounge on playa! Flaming drinks! Layered drinks! Communal drinks! Bring something to share!

title: Good Ol Fashioned Queer Disco Unicorn Weldin Party
description: Yup, just like in the olden days. We're gonna dress up in classic Village People gear, blast that disco, and have a boogieass-getdown-freakout as we weld together plate steel cutouts to make a life-sized A Cavallo carousel horse – but with a unicorn horn! We can hear the squeals now. Bring your designer eye protection and be ready to get sparks in your ass if you're wearing those chaps! (We'd remind you of the outfits, but we like imagining y'all trying to remember out loud – "So it's Indian chief, construction worker…)
print_description: Jus like in the olden days, come dress like Village People, blast disco, and have a boogieass freakout as we we weld together a life-size unicorn!

title: Gray water recycling
description: A look at how to re-use gray water in RV’s, homes, and LNT camps using filtration, distillation, and chemical purification.  Presenters will show their re-use and reclamation of gray water using the RV’s and shower structures in their camp, from using sink water to flush the toilet, filtering the water to run a swamp-cooler, up to distillation of drinking water using solar methods and waste heat from generators.

title: Green Foot Glass Camp
description: Glass Camp is a highly interactive project. Glass blowing is a mesmerizing art in itself. While it’s an art form dating backing to the birth of humanity, it’s still relatively new in the United States. The glow of a molten, honey-like material at night is hypnotic. The radiant heat of the equipment illuminating the hot shop floor is an installation in itself. Glass is a dance, with each team developing its own choreography. We intend to include the audience with ‘You Name It, We Make It’ activities. People can submit a design and our collection of talented artists will assemble what was not thought possible. Our team consists of some of the most skilled emerging and established artists in Seattle, the mecca for glass working in the world. Each night the team will take at least 2 complex designs from the audience and take the 2-D drawing and pull the 3-D design from the hot glass. There is no limit to what can be achieved in glass, and that’s what we intend to show. Glass blowing began in the Fertile Crescent and we hope to take it to Fertility 2.0. These professional artists are encyclopedias of information to anything relating to glass and high temperatures. With the making of glass, questions always arise, and we are equipped with the information to help people understand. All of our equipment was handmade by Evan Schuass, and was used last year in the Keyhole. Mobile glass studios are an excellent display of design, function, and efficiently. He has been commissioned from people all over the West Coast, and Hawaii to build these mobile shops. All the people included in Glass Camp are either producing artists or assistants to the highest level of glass workers in the world. We would like to share our gift and knowledge with the people of Burning Man. Everyone in this camp is here because they have a passion for glass art.
print_description: Green Foot Glass Camp will be having interactive glass blowing demonstrations every night. We will be blowing glass beginning at 9PM until 5AM.

title: Hang Music by Yogi Prateado
description:
Yogi Prateado travels the noosphere with the Hang, percussion, electronics, and other devices to woo harmonious realization.

The Hang, a U.F.O. looking instrument, was created in 2000, by Felix and Sabina, the Hang makers, in Bern, Switzerland. This remarkable instrument sounds like the celestial orbs, a harp, or what have you. As the primary instrument of sonic creation for Prateado, collaboration with some of the top live and electronic artists on the west coast bring an array of listening and movement experiences.

Prateado is currently based in Los Angeles, though finds home anywhere in the world, especially San Francisco, Berlin, and Rio de Janeiro.
print_description:
Enjoy beautiful music by renown hang player Yogi Prateado in our lovely chakra tenple dome.
yogiprateado.com/music/

title: Health Permit pick up & inspection reservations
description:
In order to fight the threat of food-borne illness on the playa, the Nevada State Health Division (NSHD) has requirements for camps preparing food including the need of a health permit and an inspection. You must apply for and be permitted as a Temporary Food Establishment by the NSHD if:

* You will be cooking or serving food to large groups of more than 125* FELLOW CAMPERS of your theme camp on a consistent basis.

(If you have a communal kitchen shared by 125 or more campers, but meals are prepared individually, or in smaller quantities than for 125 persons, a permit is not required, however we highly recommend you research and review safe food handling practices, starting with the Nevada Division of Health information).

* You wish to share, cook or serve food or non-alcoholic beverages to the general Burning Man population (gifting food).

Here are the permit procedures and deadlines:

If you have already applied for a permit, you should be receiving instructions in the mail soon.

If you are planning to make and give away food or drinks to the public on the playa including fresh squeezed juice, coffee with dairy, or even snow cones, you need a permit. Here's the scoop from Cindy Ulch, Supervisor with the Nevada State Health Divisions Public Health and Clinical Services Environmental Health Program:

The only application any camp needs is the "Food Permit Application for Burning Man" found here:
http://health.nv.gov/BFHS_EHS.htm 

Don't wait until the last minute. It would be a shame to have to cancel your plans, or even risk being closed at the event.  That mailing address is  NSHD - PHCS 475 West Haskell Street Suite 38, Winnemucca, NV 89445.

In person:  No later than THURSDAY AUGUST 23rd - 4150 Technology Way Suite 100, Carson City, NV.  Phone: (775) 687-7550 or 475 West Haskell Street Suite 38 Winnemucca, NV.  Phone (775) 623-6588.
print_description: Feeding 125+? Pick up your pre-ordered Nevada State Health Division food safety permit and schedule your safety inspection: Sun 8/26 - Sat 9/1.

title: Heart Opening Meditation
description: Experience Heart Opening Meditation -- an active guided meditation to music at Oasis Divinium Camp. Learn this new form of meditation practice designed for our 21st century lives. Guided, active and to music, it takes you beyond your mind to a more open heart and to a connection with higher consciousness. A three part meditation: opening, calming and thinking. Sometimes in this practice you will be quiet and still, sometimes you will move and dance, sometimes you will cry. Or not. There is no right or wrong way. You will discover for yourself what will take you deeper into your authentic self and closer to the Divine. Dedicated to more love in the world. Nudity: Not. Sexual: Not.

title: Hechi-Ken Hamazaki  Red Tea Ceremony -YOU ARE GOD-
description: The art performance by Japanese contemporary artist, Ken Hamazaki. This is the 14th Red Tea Ceremony -YOU ARE GOD- at Burning Man. This performance was inspired by and arranged from the Japanese traditional tea ceremony. The original ceremony consists of a variety of manners to drink, but to experience this fully, please simply drink with a style you favor most. The most interesting practice would be turning your thought toward him for a few minutes without speaking and enjoy drinking in this small silent space. I always serve this tea for whoever sits down in front of me. Red Tea Ceremony -YOU ARE GOD- is always a great tool to communicate universally without any thought of hierarchy. I'll be happy if we could find any great idea to make better and more enjoyable future throughout this tea ceremony. Furthermore, I will do something interesting in San Francisco before Burning Man this year. Please join us if you have time before you are headed for the playa For more detail, please visit the following links. Ken Hamazaki Red Museum http://www.kenhamazaki.jp/
print_description: The art performance by Japanese contemporary artist, Ken Hamazaki. This is the 14th Red Tea Ceremony -YOU ARE GOD- at Burning Man.
