title: Homojitoville Happy Hour
description:
The boys of Homojitoville invite you to our fabulous happy hour! Stop by camp at 8:45 & Edelweiss, facing the Man. Or find us dancing & serving icy fresh Homojitos from the fabulously appointed Mobile Homojito Dance Bar randomly in Deep Playa. Bring us your cup, we'll fill it with love!  Wednesday @ 5:00pm - 7:00pm

We will be hosting a few spontaneous cocktail hours at Homojitoville as well as at our Honorarium Art Installation "MURMURATION" and random deep playa excursions throughout the week!  Feel free to stop by camp, say hi, enjoy an icey fresh Homojito and dance below the bright puffy flowers of the Sound Garden of Eden!  

Bringing Spontaneity back to the Playa!A mirage appears in deep Playa. The aroma of fresh icy homojitos stimulates your hypothalamus. Giant bright puffy flowers belt out groovy dance beats. Leave it to serendipity and the boys of Homojitoville! Always on the move, the Mobile Homojito Dance Bar and Sound Garden of Eden appears randomly, erupting in a fabulous cocktail and dance party, then disappears. Never in the same place twice, this is no mirage. Shake your groove thing where spontaneity rules! Bring us your cup, we’ll fill it with love.

Homojitoville Facebook Page; 
https://www.facebook.com/?ref=tn_tnmn#!/pages/HomojitoVille/146746548673607

The Sound Garden of Eden; 
https://www.facebook.com/?ref=tn_tnmn#!/pages/The-SOUND-GARDEN-of-EDEN/131262300224248

Murmuration; 
https://www.facebook.com/?ref=tn_tnmn#!/pages/MURMURATION/241294435953964

Dusty Hugs!
-The Boys of Homojitoville

title: Human Carcass Wash
description:
Wash and be Washed...Be part of an interactive washing experience.

The highly regarded and much anticipated... Human Carcass Wash!!!

http://polyparadise.azcompuguy.com/hcw-how-to.htm

Get involved with some of your closest Playa friends and some new friends in trading your old Playa Dust in for a clean body ready to be dusted once again. This event honors your stated boundaries of where you do want to be touched or washed.

You will first participate in helping other Burning Man friends get washed by spraying them with Water, Dr. Bonners Peppermint Soap, washed with plenty of hands by your Playa neighbors, then sprayed again with water and squeeged off before you depart for more Playa fun. Bring a water donation to help the process along.

Hair washing may be available, depending on donated water resources and available PolyParadise members or other Playa friends willing to provide Hair Washing.

title: Introverts and Polyamory
description:
Polyamory can open up a whole new world of dating possibilities.  For the introverted and shy however, it can open up a whole new world of dating nightmares.  In this workshop we will tackle some of the challenges of entering, or re-entering the dating field, handling dating roles and imbalances.  Finding and embracing your local poly community, dealing with social awkwardness and embrace your awesome self.

We will have a few speakers who can share their experiences, perspectives and stories on how they have been able to balance being introverted, and meeting new people in the Polyamory community.

description: Mamawitz from Children of Chaos will be hosting her Jewish Mother booth again this year, dispensing advice and nurturing for all. “The Jewish Mother You Never Had” will be available 11-noon Tuesday-Friday and Mom's hours will also be posted in front of the camp. Mamawitz will be providing delicious cookies, milk, (maybe even a bagel!) and lots of love and caring for Burners requiring a little TLC - in English, Hebrew, French, and/or Spanish. The 2009 version of this event won the Acculturation Video award from Burning Man (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dtX8Z-izffs\). As Mamawitz says, "everyone needs motherly advice, but who wants to hear it from their own mother?...oy, too much baggage!" Come visit with Burning Man's very own Jewish Mother who dispenses love, nurturing, advice and no guilt (unless absolutely necessary).

YES!
Veteran Play-A builders Josh and Cody are getting married!... AGAIN! 

We tied the legal knot in March 2012 at the Jefferson Memorial here in DC (the National Park Service said it was the first gay wedding on the mall!) and now we are getting our vows renewed for all of our friends and lovers at Black Rock City!

Wednesday 4pm ..ish

Our Ceremony will be by Blue Coyote, a Druid Priest who was ordained @ Stonehenge by the Society of Bards Druids and Ovates who legally married us in DC; and we have all of the wedding party with us, with Drag stand-ins for our MOM! 

Bring all your family and join us as we celebrate almost 7 years together!

With love and dusty embrace.....

title: Kava Ceremony
description:
In Samoa, kava (called 'ava) is drunk at all important gatherings and ceremonies. The kava is prepared by a group of people called aumaga. It is brought to each participant by the tautua'ava, or 'ava server, in the order proscribed by the tufa'ava, or 'ava distributor. Usually, the highest chief of the visiting party is served first, followed by the highest chief of the host party, and then service proceeds based on the rank of the rest of the participants. The drink is served in a polished coconut half. The overall ceremony is highly ritualized, with specific gestures and phrases to be used at various times.

Our Kava ceremony will be a first come first serve event if the turnout is too overwhelming! Hope to see you there!

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samoa_%27ava_ceremony
print_description: Join Green SOL for a Samoan style Kava ceremony to celebrate gathering in BRC! It is recommended to fast 3 hours prior to the ceremony. NO ALCOHOL!!

title: Kundalini Yoga For Beginners
description:
Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul in connection with your breath and movement during this yoga class. Be inspired and take your body to a higher self-awareness by joining me in a traditional Kundalini Yoga warm-up and introductory set/kriya. If you are already experienced in yoga, you can incorporate longer time and more intense movement into the exercises, and benefit from realizing and stretching the boundaries of your physical abilities. 
Come to this class at least 90 minutes after eating a meal, in comfortable clothing that will allow for a full range of movement. Bring a healthy snack with you to enjoy after the class. Bring a water bottle you can fill it at the Pink Heart water bar, or your own favorite hydration to enjoy during the class. Yoga mat not necessary, but recommended.

title: Laughter Yoga
description: Try on Laughter Yoga to get your Xi flowing like the Playa breeze is blowing! You’ll work up a healthy appetite for whatever your evening activities may be. Start your evenings with the most intense laughter you can experience. We laugh for no reason, other than for exercise, and health. Relieve stress and pain, promote natural healing, and create spontaneous bonds of friendship through laughter. It’s fun! The brainchild of Dr. Madan Kataria in India and practiced by millions worldwide, Laughter Yoga combines Unconditional Laughter with Yogic Breathing (Pranayama). Anyone can Laugh for No Reason, without relying on humor, jokes or comedy. Laughter is simulated as a body exercise in a group; with eye contact and childlike playfulness, it soon turns into real and contagious laughter. The concept of Laughter Yoga is based on a scientific fact that the body cannot differentiate between fake and real laughter. One gets the same physiological and psychological benefits. Find much more info online by searching on Laughter Yoga, but come! Enjoy!
print_description: Laughter as exercise! Laugh with others in childlike playfulness and experience all the health benefits of a good long laugh! The Xi flowing so free!

title: Learning to Whistle
description: Whistling is in a first place tie as the most portable instrument around, but some people don't know how to use it! I want to help them learn, help them improve and let them whistle anywhere they please. This workshop will be for beginners and intermediate whistlers, with new techniques taught. I especially want to help first-timers who have been frustrated by trying to learn in the past. I'd like to have a couple of experienced volunteers to help me teach people in small groups.
print_description: Whistling is in a first place tie as the most portable instrument around, but some people don't know how to use it! Come learn how.

title: Learn the more sensual and softer side of dungeon
description: This class is an introduction into the various toys and equipment used in dungeon play. We will discuss the proper use and safety aspects in using the equipment, as well as, the importance of partner trust and safe words. The class will focus on the softer more sensual side and partnership interaction of dungeon play. Volunteers will be asked to participate in the demonstrations and all are welcome to stay afterwards to experiment and experience dungeon play. We offer a well equipped dungeon with a St Andrews cross, a seated cross, various benches, tables, a suspension area, an 8 foot chain web,in an open and semi private play areas and various types of floggers, paddles, canes, pinwheels, feathers, violet wands, fire play, and more. To ensure your safety,  all play will be supervised and we are available to provide instruction on the proper use of the equipment and can assist with fascilitating your experience. Singles, couples and groups are all welcome.
print_description: An intro of various toys and equipment and their safe use during dungeon play with focus on the softer more sensual side. Stay and play afterwards.

title: Lecture Traditional and Modern Amazonian Shamanism
description: I became interested in how the shamans utilized sound, chant and music to guide and affect trance states as well as healing. I practiced as a healer at our center (www.bluemorphotours.com), specializing in using ayahuasca and sound to heal depression and generate transcendent experience of consciousness. http://www.nationalgeographic.com/adventure/0603/features/peru.html 4 years ago I started to branch out from ayahuasca and sought to bring the unique qualities of ayahuasca shamanism to music. I wanted to use the music to guide trance states induced by the music. The theory was to guide people to heart, love and direct spiritual or transcendent experience without being told where or how to go. The music itself would guide through the mix of sounds. I started a music partnership with my wife Wendy, who is a 15 year opera, choir and rock singer to create the music. The mix of her traditional musical training with my traditional shamanic training allowed for the right combination to make the music possible.We blended the musical structure found in the shamanism to existing electronic genres like World Music and House. The music itself is electronic with vocals sung by Wendy and me.As for the burn, we have three distinct types of music we could perform. The first would be the chants and icaros of traditional amazonian shamanism (leading ceremonies for groups of people), the second would be to perform our world music and the third, our house music. In addition, lectures on ayahuasca shamanism and the traditional uses of ayahuasca, how it is practiced, apprenticeship, working with elders and the modern uses of ayahuasca for healing.  In addition I created a project called Modern Shamanism designed to create a unique form of shamanic/spiritual exploration for Modern people based out of modern life experience. I could lead trances/meditations through this practice. www.modernshamanism.org
print_description: I have studied and practiced traditional amazonian shamanism (with a focus in Ayahuasca, tree, and sanango shamanism in the Peruvian Amazon)

title: Lemon Heaven Dance Block Party
description: About the fourth day of Burning Man - 2012, God got a little bored.  Being all knowing and all seeing, he already had had his Wednesday melt down of too much dust and sun, and needed a pick Him up.  He’d taken a liking to Camp Brand Ur Ass, and its Houston contingent, the Rubber Chicken Camp - because Rubber Chickens are inherently funny; almost as funny as giraffes.  Anywho, He gave them the idea a couple of years ago to host a Lemon Heaven party - (omnipotent, remember? Sort of like Doctor Who, but without the TARDIS) and knew they’d picked up some lemons, vodka (for those of you wary of mixing), and some powdered lemon stuff, and said, “Yea, verily, thou shalt host another LEMON HEAVEN PARTY!” That was in his most impressive god voice.  He also knew they played excellent, party dance music. So, everyone who’s anyone, please join the Rubber Chicken Camp, at Camp Brand Ur Ass, on Thursday evening around 7-ish.
print_description: Come to the Rubber Chicken Camp in Camp Brand Ur Ass n More. Free flowing Vodka with Lemonade are a match made in Heaven. Excellent party dance music.

title: Leopard Lounge Day Spa & Tequila Bar
description: Our 5th year on the playa and a very popular daytime destination enjoyed by all who find us. Each year, we do nothing more than create a fun jungle-vibe space where you can get your feet (and body should you desire) rubbed, and share a shot of tequila with us. The Leopard Lounge runs on the kindness of strangers, so we also welcome you to join our staff and participate in the gifting of a footrub or massage, just be sure to do so with respect to personal boundaries. If you have other gifts to share: food, musical talent, energy work, manicure/pedicure, hair braiding, readings, etc., the Leopard Lounge is a great place to park yourself and offer your services. No scheduling or expectations, just gratitude for however long you want to contribute. The vibe is all things Jungle, Safari, Animal, so dress the part if you can!
print_description: Need we say more? Stop by for a shot of tequila, then stay for a while and get your tired feet massaged! Or join our staff and gift a foot rub or two!

title: Lessons in Sustainability
description: Do you ever wonder why the default world can't be more like Black Rock City?  Come to Earth Guardians to learn more about the environmental impact of Burning Man and how it compares to our lives in the default world.  Topics discussed will include transportation, green building, renewable energy, and strategies to incorporate lessons from the playa into the default world.  Moderated by Eli Meyer from the Sierra Green Building Association.
print_description: Come hear about strategies to incorporate lessons from the playa into the default world.  Transportation, green building, renewable energy, etc.

title: Let Love Off Its Leash
description: We're all here because we want connections with each other beyond the ordinary. We want realness, intimacy, to love and be loved with reservation. As it turns out, falling in love with each other is easy! There are just a few simple steps, and it makes life so much richer for everyone. Come spend a couple hours practicing falling in love, seeing each other and showing ourselves fully, transcending the fear and embarrassment that too often get in our way, and reaping the benefits. It's time to let love off it's leash!
print_description: Let Love Off Its Leash

For the test, the Lickee – with female anatomy - recruits one Licker with any anatomy, but with tongue ample in endurance and strength.  For each product, Lickee and Licker complete a questionnaire reporting various aspects of the product.  Each test takes about half-an-hour.  If Licker also has female anatomy, then doing a second test with Lickee/Licker roles reversed is fine.  Lickee may bring multiple Lickers, but only one Licker at a time will be permitted into the testing area.  The testing area is a group space, completely enclosed, with gym mats.  Lickee and Licker should bring towels, water, and good communication skills. Howlers should bring mufflers.  Use of the barriers is required, even if you are fluid bonded.  The object is to test the barriers.  No spectators. Photography and cell phone use are prohibited.  This is a drug free event (this includes tobacco and alcohol). title: Life Coach on Duty !!!
description:
"What is Your Wish and What is Your Obstacle?" 

One-to-one Life Coaching to discover and immediately start living the life of your dreams. 

With a real life Life Coach certified by bestselling author Barbara Sher (Live a Life you Love, Wishcraft, Refuse to Choose). 

Find out what you want, find ways to bust your blocks, have an idea party, a hard time session, learn ways to to maneuver around the resistance monster and get everything you need to get what you want.

Because what you want is what you need. And what you need is what the world needs you to do. 

Come and find out for yourself! Tuesday to Sunday every day 10am - noon @ Camp Red Lightning (9:30 E-G) - Pod: The Nest!

title: Lightlab's Transformational Sunset Party
description:
Please join us for Lightlab's first official event on the Playa...we've got lots of love to give!

Transportive soundscapes and immersive sonic wizardry will provide the backdrop for our mandalic interweaving of healing, creativity, and sacred revelry.  Drop by for a massage, Reiki treatment, or energy healing, and feel free to stay for as long as you'd like (we bet you won't want to leave).  We'll be pouring top-notch pu-erh and herbal teas, practicing "Conscious Bartending" by creating magic elixirs with artisan-distilled essential oils, and communing with plant spirits through artisan hydrosol-drinking ceremonies (have you heard that the Eleusian Mysteries are back in fashion?)

We look forward to holding space with you.  Love and light!
print_description: For you: immersive sonic wizardry, bodywork, energy healing, tea ceremonies, magic elixirs, hydrosol rituals, and a dash of love and cosmic unfolding.

The Violet wand has to be one of the most versatile and clever kink toys – join us for a game of violet wand operation (remember the game from your childhood – well it has evolved)…or just a quick taste to see if you like it.  We have been teaching and tasting with these for over 5 years and look forward to answering your questions and showing you a brave new world to explore on the Playa (and elsewhere)!

title: Live Music by Dr Notorious!
description:
Dr. Notorious is a singer-songwriter of blues-rock songs. His songs are very rhythmic with lyrics that are not entirely unwise, occasionally are salacious, and sometimes a little stupid too (The Dr. keeps striving). He writes songs, he sings, he plays guitar, he plays harmonica, and, if you buy him a drink, he may even dance for you (or with you, it depends).

After a recent performance by the Dr., a wise and quite discerning new fan told him “Your music was just as I had hoped: inspiring, energetic, heartfelt, and fun, and it got people moving.” Fun and it woke people up? Mission accomplished! Deep stuff too? Will wonders never cease?!

title: Live Music Yoga in the Morning
description: Yoga with Live Music...what a beautiful combination to start your day in Black Rock City.   Join us each morning, Tuesday through Thursday, as our highly trained yoga teachers, accompanied by professional live musicians, take your body, mind, and soul through a unique journey of exploration, rejuvenation, and musical elevation.  Located inside our very spacious, 2400 sq. ft. Embassy Shade Structure, with its woven flooring and cool breezeways...we suggest that you arrive early to reserve your favorite space.  2012 teachers include: Buckman Coe, Mangala, Bless Leone, and Meha.
print_description: Yoga with Live Music...what a beautiful combination to start your day.  Join us in our Embassy Shade structure for a journey of body, mind, and soul.

title: LIVE ROCK MUSIC
description:
Real, live music from kick ass rockers. Thursday-Saturday, 4-7P & 9P-12A. "Life is too damn short for crappy music."  Come dance your ass off with Greg and Doug, the organic jukebox duo from the Great White North.  These guys know rock: with a mental catalogue of over 3,000 tracks, they can move the crowd like Jagger.

Star Star Roadhouse is a destination… a local joint for wayward Burners looking for something different.  Here you can catch a live show: classic rock, moody blues or bluegrass… a rare experience at Burning Man. The sound system will be modest: what you'd expect to find at a honky tonk venue with live music.  Shows will be twice daily from 4-7, and 9-midnight, with an occasional after hours exception. We will be collaborating with many promoters on playa to book a variety of live bands. Yoga & dance classes will also be offered.

The stage will be decked out in classic Americana and vintage California-Nevada highway stylings, with colorful lighting, a sun bleached facade, shaded dance floor and lounge area with comfortable seating. Billiards and darts provide additional play and other interactive games are in the plans.

For added excitement and a visually stunning art experience, Artist Jamie Vaida & Crew are building the Fertility Twin mutant vehicles with indirect LED lighting, flame effects, and audio. They will either be parked near the stage or out rocking the playa with classic tunes transporting participants physically and musically.

We believe that the live music experience is unique and often absent at Burning Man and “Star Star Roadhouse” would be thrilled to offer it to the community.
print_description: Real, live music from kick ass rockers. Dance your ass off Thursday-Saturday, 4-7P & 9P-12A. "Life is too damn short for crappy music!" 8:30 & E

title: LIVE ROCK MUSIC
description:
Real, live music from kick ass rockers. Thursday-Saturday, 4-7P & 9P-12A. "Life is too damn short for crappy music."  Come dance your ass off with Greg and Doug, the organic jukebox duo from the Great White North.  These guys know rock: with a mental catalogue of over 3,000 tracks, they can move the crowd like Jagger.

Star Star Roadhouse is a destination… a local joint for wayward Burners looking for something different.  Here you can catch a live show: classic rock, moody blues or bluegrass… a rare experience at Burning Man. The sound system will be modest: what you'd expect to find at a honky tonk venue with live music.  Shows will be twice daily from 4-7, and 9-midnight, with an occasional after hours exception. We will be collaborating with many promoters on playa to book a variety of live bands. Yoga & dance classes will also be offered.

The stage will be decked out in classic Americana and vintage California-Nevada highway stylings, with colorful lighting, a sun bleached facade, shaded dance floor and lounge area with comfortable seating. Billiards and darts provide additional play and other interactive games are in the plans.

For added excitement and a visually stunning art experience, Artist Jamie Vaida & Crew are building the Fertility Twin mutant vehicles with indirect LED lighting, flame effects, and audio. They will either be parked near the stage or out rocking the playa with classic tunes transporting participants physically and musically.

We believe that the live music experience is unique and often absent at Burning Man and “Star Star Roadhouse” would be thrilled to offer it to the community.
print_description: Real, live music from kick ass rockers. Dance your ass off Thursday-Saturday, 4-7P & 9P-12A. "Life is too damn short for crappy music!"

Lecture/Discussion from 11-12 in the SSV Main Hall, followed by interactive activity from 12-1 in a smaller more intimate space.

title: Logos live with Clan Destiny Circus
description: In the world of electronic dance music, few artists transcend genre with as unique and epic a style as LOGOS. Composer and producer Jim Genaro weaves together a rich tapestry of sounds, drawing influences from psychedelic trance and house music, but also from industrial, world beat, progressive rock, and even classical roots. LOGOS takes the energy and sounds of the dance floor and layers them with complex harmonies and melodies that send the listener on a journey into new sonic dimensions.
print_description: LOGOS weaves together a tapestry of sounds, drawing from psychedelic trance, house, industrial, world beat, progressive rock and classical.

title: Longevity Stick Art
description: The sun’s just up, but not too hot yet. Come for an early hour of low impact exercise in the Longevity Stick Art (LSA) discipline of 12 low-impact exercises to build balance, flexibility, strength, mental focus, breathing capacity, and vitality, and open your points and channels. Bring your water or hydration liquid. We’ll have sticks available for you. Master Mai Bac Dao developed the Longevity Stick Art discipline while he was a prisoner of war of the North Vietnamese Army. He helped his fellow prisoners restore and maintain their health through LSA, and vowed that if he was ever freed, he would dedicate his life to spreading its benefits to the world, with the proviso that no future trainer could ever charge for the course. (Sounds like "gifting," eh?) He was freed, settled in Southern California, and started teaching classes of students and future teachers. Today, there are dozens of classes weekly around So Cal. Also, LSA is spreading around the US and world. Many more details are available at: www.longevitystick.org/Longevitystick.org/Home.html and www.filmbaby.com/films/2341 Master Dao passed away late 2010 at age 89, and one of our campers was privileged to attend his funeral, and his last birthday party, a few months before.
print_description: The sun’s just up, but not too hot yet. It’s 1 early hour of lo impact exercise to build balance and open points & channels. Bring H2O. We got sticks!

title: Losing Your Religion
description: Some people think religion is a way to control the ignorant masses. Others turn to religion for solace and direction. Religious dogma can serve to uplift and inspire or separate and control. This ritual will help you strip away the confining, controlling aspects of religion to live peacefully and harmoniously. Designed by a shaman and healer to guide those seeking freedom to safely strip away the parts and pieces of religious dogma that serves to limit self-expression and love.
print_description: Come participate in a ritual to shed the religious dogma/persecution and heal the wounds you've suffered from your religious past.

VW Bus Camp LOVEs hoopers! All levels are LOVEingly welcomed to this unique hoop-ening! All celestial signs are pointing to a global shift in human potential for LOVE, so this year's hoopjam theme is "All LOVE, All the Time"! With the incredible sound system provided by Walter, The World's Largest VW Bus, we will spin and groove to an entire playlist full of, you guessed it, LOVE songs! Stop by our Leopard Lounge before or after the jam to get to know and LOVE our wonderful campmates! RED is THE color to wear this day, but we don't mind if you come just as you are - we LOVE you! XOXO
Update! VW Bus Camp is placed at 3:15 Edelweiss!

Join Matt for both a strengthening and therapeutic all levels 1 hour
yoga class.  Experience the effects of connecting to both the breath

dimensions of life.

title: Merkabah Bass Yoga with Lux Moderna
description: Join Lux Moderna as she guides you through a series of yogic and meditative practices that emphasize the conscious, embodied alchemy of sound and light! Merkabah Yoga is a unique fusion of Kundalini Yoga, Kabbalah, and the bass mantra music of Lux Moderna and DJ/producer Dubvirus. Together we will engage in practices such as Pranayama, Sacred Geometry-oriented Asana, Mantra (Chanting), Mudras (Sacred Hand Gestures), and Meditation. Begins at 11:11am.
print_description: Join Lux Moderna as she guides you through a series of yogic and meditative practices that emphasize the conscious.

title: Merkin Pageant
description:
A 'Merkin' pageant for both ladies and gents.  The ladies pageant will be entitled "Annie's Fannies"  and the gents "Gerkin Merkins".


The pageant will be open for entrants from both the Public and camp members.  An appropriate prize will be awarded for the winner in each pageant.


Each pageant will be judged by a panel of 4 camp members, 2 gents and 2 ladies.  The same panel will judge each pageant. On the grounds of impartiality the camp members chosen to judge will not be allowed to enter the pageant.


Each panel member can award points on a scale of 1-10 for:


Design, Implementation, Originality, Mooplessness. 


In the event of a tie we ask the audience to cheer for their choice and the entrant with the loudest cheer will win.


During the event our bar will offer two speciality drinks.  The combination of some of the finest beer and lemonade will be sold as 'Annie's Hand Shandy'.   A suitable cocktail will be concocted and sold as 'Annie's Merkin Mix'.
print_description: A 'Merkin' pageant for both ladies and gents.  The ladies pageant will be entitled "Annie's Fannies"  and the gents "Gerkin Merkins".

title: Mindful Meditation Practice
description: Come sit for a bit and engage in traditional meditation practice. Ground into presence and awareness, open with equanimity to what is happening moment-by-moment, and let the energies within you untangle and flow. A guided meditation will help us bring balanced, clear awareness to our breath, body sensations, and thoughts in our minds, with some time afterwards for question and answer, and discussion.

title: Mindfulness and Flow: Bros or Foes?
description: What is flow & what is mindfulness? How do these two relate theoretically and practically in our daily lives? Are they competing or cooperating? Share your experiences and thoughts. Discussion with light facilitation.

title: Mind Melt
description:
Mind Melt lets your mind be changed from Fear of the unknown, to finding Hope in the Future, by experiencing 3-D Images of lights and sounds and the peace only found within the receptive mind and experience of every thought, feelings, sensations, and level of awareness through corresponding brain wave patterns.

Mind machines change your perception by stimulating balanced, abundant neurotransmitter production, expanding neural pathways, and programming desirable, ecologically sound behaviors. The use of mind melting can enhance physical healing and homeostasis, intellectual performance, and greatly improved a sense of well-being, which allows one to See beauty where others do not, and a new perception of life that is the Future for all Mankind.

Remember; nothing really exists, it’s all in the electrons of your mind.

title: Miso Soup
description: Our goal for this "Miso soup camp" is to prevent electrolyte imbalance for Burners. According to wikipedia, Pure miso paste nutritional information: Although high in sodium (over 400% DV), one cup (275 g) of miso paste is an excellent source of dietary fiber (59%) and protein (64% DV), as well as a good source of minerals . Miso paste is also high in amino acids, the basic building blocks of protein. An excellent source of vitamin K and a decent source of riboflavin (38% DV), miso also provides small amounts of other vitamins. One major benefit of miso is its extremely high omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acid content. We believe Miso saves Burners life on the Playa and leave them with good health all day.
print_description: Our goal for this "Miso soup camp" is to prevent electrolyte imbalance for Burners. We must eat salty food on the Playa. Please bring your own cup.

title: Money Grows On Trees
description: 1worldcurrency.net will be hosting a currency creation workshop at Shwar Town camp located @ 8:30 and D in the Shamans story Tipi. Messenger Joshua tells of the serpent viper money changers concealing the truth that "Money Grows on Trees"  It was the secret lost in the Garden of Eden that we now remember. Learn the truth about money, how to end usury and deliver the gifting economy to the default world. All tribes unite as we co-create a resource based currency, grown organically out of the ground. Learn of the ancient granary receipt and how it can free any agricultural community from FIAT currency. Learn of "unity through currency", and how we can eat nuclear submarines for snack time. Dragons, serpents and those who sold their souls to the front of the line.

title: Moontribe/Jabba Barge Full (Blue) Moon Gathering
description:
SoCal's Moontribe Collective will be teaming up with the amazing Jabba Barge art car to celebrate the 2nd full moon of August from 10pm on Thursday night, August 31st to around 10am on Friday morning.

We will be playing our deepest, funkiest, danciest beats on the Ohm Guru Sound System: a Turbo/FunktionOne system run by its master: Jon Cooper. Breaks, dubstep, techno, house, drum and bass, and downtempo will be delivered by Kayla Scintilla, Christian Martin, Desert Dwellers, Quade, Brad, Treavor, dela, Bartek, and Bim Tim.

For 1 night only, we will set up the full system in front of the Jabba Barge art car somewhere beyond the Temple -- next to our favorite art installation (to be determined). 

Pickle Joint (located in the Center Camp vicinity) will act as our map point on Thursday. People can stop by the bar from the afternoon on and find out where the gathering will be.

title: Munchkin Monday
description:
Munchkin is a card-game spoof of D&D with loads of silliness and none of that roleplaying stuff. (OK, maybe *some* roleplaying stuff.) Rip open the tent flap! Kill the monsters! Backstab your friends and steal their stuff... on the playa! Grab the booty and run. We will compete to kill monsters and collect magic items. We have a number of different games that can even be mixed and matched. The Good, The Bad and the Munchkin, Munchkin Booty, Munchkin Bites, Star Munchkin, Munchkin Zombies, Munchkin Impossible and Munchkin Fu.

Battle the Banshee, Gregor, the Maggot or Frank Limejello. Wear the Pointy Hat of Great Power, Seven years of Ick, or the Evil Eye Shadow. Fight with your banana-fana-fo-faser or steam powered tomahawk.

We’ll try to have several games going and Munchkins and Mimosas until they run out.

title: Naked Comedy Showcase
description:
The Naked Comedy Showcase is the creation of Andy Ofiesh, a stand-up comedian from Boston, Massachusetts. For years Andy has organized hosted naked comedy shows featuring Boston area comics doing stand-up in the nude. Andy's first naked comedy show in a public venue was at Improv Boston this past summer days before going to the Edinburgh Fringe in August. News of the event spread quickly and preceded his arrival in Edinburgh.

"A group of American comics have performed what could be the world's first naked stand-up show. The little-publicised event in Boston on Tuesday night was a sell-out."
— Chortle

After arriving in Scotland for the Edinburgh Festival Fringe, Andy seized an opportunity at Spank!, the late night comedy showcase at Smirnoff Underbelly, to do a 1 minute naked promo for the show that he was performing in called Why Work?. The overwhelming positive response at the event prompted Andy to host his Naked Comedy Showcase in Edinburgh.

Encouraged by the success of the shows at Improv Boston and at The Fringe in Edinburgh, Andy has organized an ongoing monthly naked comedy show at Improv Boston. News of the show was reported in both of Boston's major newspapers:

"Once a month, [Andy] does onstage what most of us could only imagine in our worst nightmare: naked stand-up-comedy...What's more astonishing is that Ofiesh has persuaded other performers to try nude stand-up, too, and now hosts "the Naked Comedy Showcase" at Improv Boston the First Wednesday of every month."
— Nick Zaino, Boston Globe

"Spectators who appreciated the comedy seemed to outnumber those who may have simply wanted to see naked people."
— Sean L McCarthy, Boston Herald

Now for the first time the Naked Comedy Showcase can be seen at Burning Man!!!
print_description: It is what it says. It's a comedy open mic and you have to be naked to perform. Send an email if you want to perform.

title: Naked Pub Crawl
description:
Each year since 2004, hundreds of naked burners meet at the Man to consume a little liquid courage, and pedal off into the City for a few hours of bar hopping.  Six host camps will have bartenders standing by with icy libations prepared exclusively for the ride participants.  We’ll be stopping off at Barbie Death Camp & Wine Bistro, Celestial Bodies, Camp Swede, and the Tiki Bar.  How many naked cyclists can we squeeze into a tiki bar?  Come help us break last year’s record.  We’ll also be hitting Duckpond for keg beer and some slip-’n-slide action.  As always, the famous naked bartenders of Comfort & Joy will be hosting the after party.  This ride isn’t just an event, it’s a tradition.  So if you’re willing to meet the dress code, join us for one of the silliest parties on the playa.  Trust us, after the first couple of cocktails you won’t mind being naked. 

If you're interested in helping to steward the ride, contact us at dunneasley@hotmail.com.  We can always use more rider wranglers.
print_description: Six camps will be standing by with icy cocktails. It's like Critical Mass with alcohol and blatant public nudity. 350 mugs for the early arrivers.

title: On Attaining Buddhahood in this Lifetime
description: What is Buddhahood? Is it just for Shakyamuni? Is it just for monks removed from day to day life? Do you have to sell all your worldly possessions? Nope. The potential for Buddhahood exists within everyone in their current form. All we need is the tool to call it out from within and experience a state of unshakeable happiness and compassion. Come join us for a discussion about a Buddhist practice that opens the door for anyone to attain this supreme state of life.

title: Opening the Tree of Life
description:
Come and get best energetic initiation of 2012. This ancient key, bridging Tao and Yoga has been rediscovered when we need it most.

We begin by smiling together, inside and out, to build a heart-expansive group energy. We experience our energy following attention, hand to hand, person to person. Then we use savoring awareness, as with chocolate in our minds (bring enough to share,) to open the ten energy gates of the Tree of Life on the body. 

Come as you are and tune each other up with your smile and your savor.

title: Palenque Norte Speaker Series
description:
Since 2003, Palenque Norte has been the Burning Man reincarnation of the legendary Entheobotany Conferences held near the ancient Mayan temples near Palenque, Mexico. There, Terence McKenna, Jonathan Ott, Ann & Sasha Shulgin, and a host of other luminaries held forth. This year we are featuring many visionary talks, community circles, art and performances on subjects such as: the psychedelic experience and research, technological transformation of the human condition and far future, the weird and the strange, and healing plant medicines. 

Bruce Damer, Annie Oak, Robert Forte and many others (TBA) will be joining us for three afternoons of lively sessions which will be held in The Crystal Cavern at Camp Above the Limit. Our schedules are posted daily.

As is our tradition, all sessions will be later broadcast in the Psychedelic Salon podcast.
print_description: Visionary talks and discussion, community circles & art: consciousness, psychedelics, technology & human future, weird and strange, healing medicines.

title: Palenque Norte Speaker Series
description:
“It’s like TED talks for Psychedelics” 

The Palenque Norte Speaker Series is a series of lectures focused on altered states of consciousness, psychedelic medicines, and the mystical experience. We will be returning to the Burning Man festival for the first time since 2007, and need your help to make this happen. We’ve put together an amazing schedule of 22 speakers across 4 days which include luminaries such as Alex and Allyson Grey, Paul Stamets, Daniel Pinchbeck, Rick Doblin and many more. The talks will hosted by Camp Above the Limit and be located in the Crystal Cavern, a 40’ dome at 9:15 & B. 

Check out the full schedule and audio from past lectures at: http://www.matrixmasters.com/pn/ 

Palenque Norte History

The Palenque Norte journey began with the legendary Entheobotany Conferences held at the Chan Kah hotel near the ancient Mayan ruins just outside of Palenque, Mexico. There, Terence McKenna, Jonathan Ott, Ann & Sasha Shulgin, and a host of other psychedelic luminaries passed along many insights, discoveries, and wild tales to the fortunate Tribe members who were there. And it was at the end of the pool where Terence McKenna gave some of his last talks at the Chan Kah.

Years later, then in 2003, a few alumni from those conferences decided to have a "Palenque reunion" at the Burning Man Festival, and so we organized a theme camp and lecture series to continue the Palenque tradition.
print_description: Lectures focused on altered states of consciousness, psychedelic medicines, and the mystical experience.

title: Panel On Conscious Relating
description:
The most fertile ground for the creation of life – our most precious and miraculous resource – is the context of a conscious relationship.  Those bonds of love form the fabric of our society and its ability to love, heal, and evolve – and your relationships are the crucible for your own transformation.   Learn how the total context of your relationship can be conscious love in this experiential dialog.

Relationships are the crucible for your own transformation. Join us in this experiential dialog on how the total context of your relationship can be conscious love.

title: Panel on Conscious Sexuality
description:
Where are you in your own hero’s journey with respect to your sexuality?  Most psychological constructs acknowledge that sex and sexuality play a core role in the human tendencies towards achievement, success, fulfillment, control, and aggression.   How can conscious sexuality and the possible resulting sexual liberation lead to a broader liberation and re-fertilize the landscapes of creativity, collaborate effort, and peaceful conflict?  Join a diverse panel of experts and practitioners representing many interpretations of conscious sexuality.

Can conscious sexuality lead to a broader liberation and re-fertilize the landscapes of creativity, collaborate effort, and peaceful conflict?

title: Panel on Cross Fertilization
description:
A recent study observed participants trapped in an elevator in groups of 10 or 11 people.  It turns out that the amount of time it takes a group of strangers to solve an unexpected problem is directly related to its diversity.  Completely homogenous groups failed to get out of their elevator at all, while the most diverse groups escaped in a few minutes.  This points to what we know intuitively to be true which is the cross fertilization of ideas, methodologies, and perspectives is essential to solving the biggest problems facing humanity today.

The cross fertilization of ideas, methodologies, and perspectives is essential to solving the biggest problems facing humanity today.
print_description: The cross fertilization of ideas, methodologies, and perspectives is essential to solving the biggest problems facing humanity today.

Learn about your gender differences and how to overcome the tendency toward confusion of the second (sexual) chakra with its adjacent neighbors - the first (root/kundalini pump) and third (solar plexus/control) chakras. Learn to work with your Chi energy, and how the second chakra borrows energy from the 1st and 3rd. We will explore how these chi variations differ throughout the stages of the sexual response cycle. title: Partner yoga, flying and partner massage
description:
This workshop will warm you up with a playful and silly group yoga asana then take you through a few strengthening drills and partner stretches to get your body ready for play! 

You’ll then learn how the three roles of a partner flying work – the flyer, base and spotter – and learn how to support your partner in comfortable and therapeutic yoga poses up in the air!

We will finish with partner massage techniques that will connect you to your partner and keep the yumminess flowing.

No need to bring a partner, just yourself and some childish curiosity
print_description: This workshop will warm you up with a playful & silly group yoga asana then take you through a few strengthening drills &partner stretches.

title: Party for Gingers!
description: Are you a ginger?  A red-headed bombshell?  A pasty prince? Come to camp Friends United and enjoy a safe, shaded space for friendly intra-ginger appreciation.  Enjoy ginger snaps, orange jello shots, and ginger beer as we drink until we're red in the face.  What happens when people of such rare pedigree party together?  Who knows!  It's never happened!  We can discuss our favorite red heads, play 'find the freckle,' and maybe even have a conan obrian look-alike contest!  Maybe it'll be a raucous shit show or maybe just a mob of burners constantly reapplying sun screen.  Let's find out!  With hundreds of gingers on the playa we're also looking to break the record for most gingers in a single place; the previous record is six. Note: Severely sun burnt burners do not count.  Also, this is a safe environment for gingers so no red-head-fetish onlookers please (unless you're a ginger too, in which case come on in).  If you're name is Ginger you can come we suppose.
print_description: Are you a ginger? Come to Camp FU and enjoy a shaded,safe space for friendly intra-ginger appreciation. ginger beer, gingersnaps, and spf500 provided.

title: Party Naked and Get Lei'd
description: Party Naked is returning to the Playa for our fifth year to provide libations to thirsty Black Rock City citizens 21 and over. You must be 21 or over to Party here and we do ask for and check ID's (it's always good to carry your ID while at Burning Man). We start the mornings with Bloody Mary's at 9:00am until we run out. We then dispense our "Tiki Punch" (yes, it has a punch) well into the night. Party Naked Tiki Bar is the clothing optional bar that rewards your getting naked. This year we have 1800+ hand painted commemorative leis to give to citizens that "do it". Make sure to come by early and get lei'd. We will also have activities scheduled for fun at the bar, check out our schedule when you come by. We promote a no pressure relaxed atmosphere where you can get naked or not. Come by for a cool drink where you can sit and chat or meet new people. Enjoy our classic rock atmosphere music and a little shade in the heat of the day. Be LNT friendly and bring your own cup please.
print_description: Serving cold Tiki Punch to BRC citizens 21+ for 5 years. Have a seat, enjoy the rock, get naked here you may get lei'd.Please bring own cup and ID.

title: Pheremonal Speed Dating
description: Come discover your most primal human attractions using nothing more than a sweaty t-shirt that you've worn for 24 hours on the playa!  In this experiment in human biological compatibility, participants seal their pheromone-soaked clothing in an anonymous plastic bag.  Subjects sniff their way through each bag and mark the degree to which they’re attracted or replused by each smell.  After a little decompression, matches will be announced to the surprise and delight of all involved.   Both LGBT and Straight friendly.  All are welcome, but make sure to show up on time with a sweaty T-shirt if you want to participate!

title: Pilates
description: Core strength is the foundation of Pilates exercise. The core muscles are the deep, internal muscles of the abdomen and back. When the core muscles are strong and doing their job, as they are trained to do in Pilates, they work in tandem with the more superficial muscles of the trunk to support the spine and movement. Centering, Control, Flow, Breath, Precision, and Concentration: These six Pilates principles are essential ingredients in a high quality Pilates workout. Pilates mat exercises will develop strength, flexibility, coordination and balance.

title: Pinata's Revenge
description: PIÑATA'S REVENGE is a moving interactive performance in which a 'Living Piñata' (a person in an elaborate Piñata costume) is suspended from a large moving boom above our Art Car, the PiñataMobile. One at a time, individuals will be allowed to engage the Piñata in traditional piñata-combat--involving padded bats. Just as with a traditional piñata, if people strike the 'Living Piñata's body hard enough, treasures will 'bleed' forth. But unlike a traditional piñata, people will have to strike with care, because THIS TIME the Piñata will ALSO be armed with a padded bat--with which to exact its revenge! Behold--PIÑATA'S REVENGE!
print_description: The Pinata finally has its revenge! Dare to be blindfolded & engage the Living Pinata in traditional combat. Do YOU bleed sweets too? Let's find out!

title: Plan B Laboratories
description:
In the strong Moonrock tradition of fuckery, revelry, and great bad
ideas, Plan B Laboratories aims to create alternative solutions to
common festival problems. Citizens can come avail themselves of our 
unorthodox answers to everyday disasters during daily staffed business hours. 
For instance, if your bike threw its chain, well, we can maybe hook you up 
with a martini. Or if you're down a shoe, we might have just the rollerskate 
you didn't know you needed. And if your problems are of a more abstract nature,
there'll be plenty of questionable advice on offer, too!

With the help of Plan B’s resources and regularly-scheduled workshops,
you won’t need a Plan C.
print_description: Plan B Laboratories: Solutions to common festival problems. Flat tire? No martini olives? With the help of Plan B’s resources you won't need a Plan C.

description:
PLAYA 54 - A happy little groove In The Afternoon!! - LA DJs spin the best of the 80's, Disco, House & More!! Come Get Your Groove On and LET'S DANCE!! DJ schedule subject to Playa Time!! 

PLAYA 54 stickers available while supplies last. Come early and get one, they ROCK!!

We will be located in the 9:00 Sector - Look for us...Stop by for a Dance or Bounce by on your bike and wave "HI!" Either way, we'll be HAPPY to see you!!

This is our second year as a theme camp!! We are doing all we can to step up our game for you guys!! We hope you'll like our camp and that you'll visit often!!

ALSO, we'll be hosting the one and only stage in the Beer Gardens of LA Decompression - October 13th. Stop by there too, dance and say "HI!"

Burn On Dusty Folks!! )'(

Confessions can be about a humorous event on the playa, a recent revelation, or even some type of rant. So if you see a bright yellow taxi raise your hand and shout, "TAXI!".

title: PLAYA ESSENTIALS EASTER EGG HUNT!
description: Consider the Humble Egg, a simple yet profound symbol of Springtime and fertility. What if you could find a colored Easter egg somewhere in BRC, filled with goodies essential to playa comfort and pleasure? We will be hiding Easter eggs in public every day in areas like Center Camp, the Esplanade, even freshly cleaned porta potties! Enjoy the contents and please let us know how you used yours to improve your Burning Man experience at https://www.facebook.com/mitz.tops
print_description: We will be hiding Easter eggs full of Playa essentials in public every day in areas like Center Camp,Esplanade, even freshly cleaned porta potties!

title: Playa Fashion Makeovers
description: Are you ready for a new you?   Allow our Playa Fashion, Makeup, and Body Paint experts the opportunity to get you spiffed up properly for the event and take a turn on our fashion runway afterwards.   This is guaranteed to improve your chances of getting laid at Burning Man.

title: Play: "After Revolution"
description:
A Site-Specific Play for The Playa. 

A washed-up barren land where nothing grows, where all is arid and plain. Not a morsel to eat or a drop to be drunk. A scurvy crew of renegades have survived but what is their fate? Surely some revelation is at hand; Surely the Second Coming is at hand.
 
Join us on our theatrical journey to the New World. Look out for the white mast of the SS Serpent Queen, steaming across the esplanade from sundown, Thursday.

Come to Camp 2.45 and Jasmine for showtimes. There will also be a secret 4am matinee performance.
print_description: A washed-up barren land, arid and plain. A scurvy crew have survived but what is their fate? The SS Serpent Queen's theatrical journey to salvation.

title: Playa-Galactic Gargleblaster Meetup
description: Hoopy froods who know where their towel is are invited to meet up with a highly improbable crowd of like-minded interstellar travelers to share their best efforts at a pan-galactic gargleblaster. Remember, the effect of drinking one of these is rather like having your brains smashed out with a slice of lemon, wrapped around a large gold brick. Concoct your version from findings across our dusty universe and meet us at its end to share and contemplate.
print_description: Hoopy froods who know where their towel is are invited to share their best pan-galactic gargle blaster at the end of our dusty universe. BYOGB.

title: Playa Jeopardy-Fertility 2.0 Edition
description:
Reverend Billy returns to host this dust bowl of Playa knowledge with a fecund and fun theme: Videogasm Jeopardy-Fertility 2.0 Edition. 

Find fame and decommodified fortune sowing your seeds as a contestant or voyeur in categories such as "Playa Players and Soothsayers," "Fertile Myrtle," "Sam Hall with One Ball," "Ann's Mitt with Two Clits," and "Events with a Playa Accent."

Our misting tunnel and hair washing will leave you refreshed and once again ready to plunder the playa. Open 10:00 to 3:00 for Salon hair washing for those whose hair meets the “crunchy hair test” with misting throughout the heat of the day. Other spa services. Disclaimer: Due to popular demand for hair washing, the crunchy hair test is strictly administered to serve only the most deserving; exceptions may be made for poetic or other performances.

title: Playa Poems by Projekt575
description: Through the ancient Japanese art of Haiku, Projekt575 will be an outlet for you to contemplate your experiences, thoughts, and feelings in the moment. Back in default world, we hope to share these moments in order to conjure nostalgia and understanding. Participants will be invited to write down the Haiku they come up with at that very moment. We will photograph the poem, which will later be posted on www.projekt575.com.  With your permission, of course!  We hope to have a great catalog of people's experiences to look back on, and remember that place we call "Home"
print_description: Through the ancient Japanese art of Haiku, Projekt575 will be an outlet to solidify your experiences, thoughts, and feelings in the moment.

title: Playa Punch & Misinformation!
description:
The Bureau of Misinformation has all the answers you never wanted to hear. And after we've sufficiently misinformed you, we'll drown your sorrows with Playa Punch, Giant Jenga, twister and awesomeness!

Come by any time, all the time.  We've got booze, good tunes, an air brush artist, and a whole lot of awesome.  

Cheers!

title: Playa Puzzlehunt
description:
Solve puzzles alone or together! Grab the first (easy) clue from Camp Cydonia, in the Alternative Energy Zone village, then take your time wandering the playa and searching for more.

Valuable prizes include: Love, the joy of discovery, the approval and praise of your fellow humans.

(Other prizes subject to availability, void where prohibited, do not lick, see your doctor if prizes last more than four hours.)

Come get your first clue from us whenever you're ready. Each clue, when solved, will lead you somewhere on the playa to find the next one. Once you get to the end, bring the last one back to us for valuable prizes as described above.

We promise fun times for all. (Actually we promise nothing, but we bet you'll enjoy it!) Come try it out!
print_description: Come solve puzzles with us! Grab the first (easy) clue from Cydonia in Alternative Energy Zone, then wander the playa searching for more. Try it out!

title: PNW Sunrise at the Temple of Juno
description:
Calling BC/Washington burners...
Vancouver, Victoria, Bellingham, Seattle plus surrounding areas & any of our friends!
Wouldn't it be nice to be sure to catch at least ONE SUNRISE?
Wouldn't it be nice to share that with the people you know from the default world?
That's what WE THOUGHT!

An annual tradition, the last several years’ Wednesday morning PNW gatherings have been really great! An opportunity to see many people that you otherwise might not see at any other time during the week... Several people said they really appreciated the callout, as it ensured that they would catch at least ONE sunrise! And it's a sweet time to visit the Temple, mid-week, mid-progress with everyone adding their words & thoughts...

Meet you at the Temple, sunrise side, on Wednesday at 6am, & we'll watch the sun rise together.
Nice & simple, bring whatever you feel to share, or not!
Invite your friends, campmates, associates... & we'll see you there.

Wed Sunrise at Temple of Juno, Black Rock City
Wed Aug 29, 6am meetup
print_description:
PNW Sunrise at the Temple of Juno
Calling BC/Washington burners & friends!
Wed Aug 29, 6am sunrise meetup at the Temple.

title: Poly High Tea
description:
Just what is Poly High Tea? - First, it's a Tea Party. We will be serving Tea and Cookies...

All you Polyamorous, poly-curious, and poly-friendly folks out there on the playa are invited to join us for a discussion about the practical issues of loving more than one in an open, responsible multi-person relationship. There are many workable forms of Polyamorous relationship - polyamory is polymorphic! There is much wisdom in the poly community which can be helpful to people trying to make *any* relationship work, monogamous or Polyamorous. There will be a facilitated discussion in which you can get your questions addressed and some of the knowledge in our community can be shared.

If you'd like to cool off and de-dust yourself after our tea party, bring a water donation to enjoy PolyParadise's famous Human Carcass Wash.
print_description: All you Polyamorous, poly-curious, and poly-friendly folks are invited to join us for a discussion about practical issues of loving more than one.

title: Pop n Lock TuTu Tues Guinness World Record
description:
Lets smash the Guinness world record set by Jimmy Fallon of having the most people/longest "Pop-N-Lock"! The record is 52 people. The goal is 300 people or more. Meet at the Man Tuesday @ 7PM and lets get to movin! We will be video taping and having people sign in to document this event to submit into Guinness book of world records. So if you do not want to be video taped... fizzball is going on at BDV!  If you do not know what a pop-n-lock is you can look it up online. anyone of any age can do it.Once we are all holding hands it will go by in under 3 minutes depending on how many people show up.
WEAR YOUR TUTU'S OR COME AS YOU ARE.
print_description: Always wanted to be a record holder? Can you move your arms? Show up to the man at 7pm Tues. and lets break a world record!

Mooney retools the ancient Christian practices of Lectio Divina (divine reading) and Examen, and deepens their impact through full-spectrum experiences of spoken word, visual art, music, body movement, and meditation.  Praxis Divina is a process of self-discovery and spiritual awareness through a gradual deepening of individual contemplation, and a small-group time of deep listening as we “hear one another into speech and wisdom.”

title: Pre-Critical Tits Liquid Latex Body Adornment
description: This is a women’s-only event, held in an enclosed space.   You are the artist.  Paint yourself and your female friend(s).  Come early.  Liquid latex body painting can take over an hour to design, paint, and dry.  Multiple layers are recommended.  The Critical Tits Bike Ride (usually) starts at the Man at 4:00.   You will need to be painted by 3:30, so you need to arrive before 2:00. We provide mirrors and liquid latex colored with food-coloring and other (labeled) dyes.  Use our colors or mix your own.  Cloth is available for appliqué.    Females are invited to become participants as artistic/latex-advisors, etc. Jump in for an hour or so on the spot, or contact the e-mail address below.    No spectators. Photography and cell phone use are prohibited.  This is a drug free event (this includes tobacco and alcohol).

title: Premiere 48 Hour Film Project Black Rock City 2012
description: Come to the "On the Red Carpet" Premiere to watch the results of the Black Rock City 48 Hour Film Project! Each of these movies was made in 48 hours on the Playa. "Cinderplaya" features a wizard searching for his Playa love. "Portaman" discovers a mastermind's plan to destroy Burningman. "Sister Lucy" helps Burners learn about sex. During "Abandon All Hope and Fear", a dream teaches the way of the Playa. More movies will be included. The 48 Hour Film Project's mission is to advance filmmaking and promote filmmakers. Through its festivals the Project encourages filmmakers and would-be filmmakers to get out there and make movies. The tight deadline of 48 hours puts the focus squarely on the filmmakers—emphasizing creativity and teamwork skills. While the time limit places an unusual restriction on the filmmakers, it is also liberating by putting an emphasis on "doing" instead of "talking." At Videogasm in Snowflake Village at 8:15 & Edelweiss. Bring your own chair or tarp. Note, to join the BRC 48 Hour Film Project to help make a film, come to the kick-off at Videogasm on Tuesday, August 28th between 3-5 PM.
print_description: Come see the results of the Black Rock City 48 Hour Film Project! Each of these movies was made in 48 hours on the Playa.

title: Psychedelic Drug Development/Harm Reduction
description: Presented by Rick Doblin.  We'll review the latest progress by non-profit organizations in developing psychedelic drugs into prescription medicines, especially the use of MDMA-assisted psychotherapy in veterans and others with chronic PTSD.  We’ll also discuss psychedelic harm reduction at festivals, with the world’s leading example being Boom Festival in Portugal, where drugs are decriminalized.
print_description: Presented by Rick Doblin.  We'll review the latest progress by non-profit organizations in developing psychedelic drugs into prescription medicines.

title: Psychedelic Harm Reduction as Cultural Change
description: Presented by Brad Burge.  The legal therapeutic uses of psychedelics are reaching unprecedented levels of acceptance in professional medicine and popular culture. Is there a tension between non-profit organizations supporting psychedelic harm reduction and education at community events and gaining the mainstream legitimacy required to take psychedelic research to the next level?

title: Recitation of Lotus Sutra: Nam Myoho Renge Kyo
description: Join us in our Lotus Dome for the daily recitation of Nam Myoho Renge Kyo and morning gongyo (the practice of chanting two chapters from the Lotus Sutra) In the Lotus Sutra Shakymuni Buddha revealed that every human being can attain enlightenment in their present form. Through chanting Nam Myoho Renge Kyo an individual is able to awaken this enlightenment the Buddha revealed and reveal their own Buddha nature. A practitioner of this Buddhism through chanting and study can transform their life and create a state of unshakable happiness overcoming the sufferings of birth and death. Buddhism is a practice and everyone is welcome to join. Each day after chanting together we will study a Buddhist concept, answer questions and share experiences about the practice and its application to our daily life. All are welcome to join us even if you have never chanted before.
print_description: Chanting of Nam Myoho Renge Kyo & Lotus Sutra. Join us to learn about practicing Buddhism and reveal your enlightened nature. All welcomed.

title: Reclaiming 2012: the transformative meme
description: Mark Heley will be presenting a totally new talk featuring new archaeological and epigraphic evidence of the significance of 2012 in the Maya cosmovision. Factual, informative and inspiring, this talk explores the transformative, visionary and psychedelic roots of the 2012 movement and presents a clear plan for reclaiming the 2012 meme as a celebration of planetary culture.
print_description: Mark Heley will be presenting a new talk featuring new archaeological and epigraphic evidence of the significance of 2012 in the Mayan cosmovision.

title: Recoding the Transformation
description:
One of the most historically influential decades, the 1960s came and went, taking with them the ideologies of consciousness exploration, active environmentalism and true freedom until now.  After over 40 years of dormancy, a new revolution has emerged, taken shape, revealed its face and resonated a strong voice to guide the global community.

Mitch Schultz and Charles Shaw share their new feature length documentary that focuses the lens at the nexus of this next-generation mystical revival.  The growing worldwide community of like minds continues to grow and intentionally gather to celebrate life and create positive change on the planet.  The project takes the pulse of the culture at transformational festivals around the world in 2012, including Symbiosis, Lightning in a Bottle, Desert Rocks, Sonic Bloom, Boom, Burning Man, Australia’s Eclipse 2012 and Belize Solstice 2012, and many more.  With the backdrop of these amazing festivals and communicated through the individual festival participants, we explore a variety of different themes, including activism, art, consciousness, environmentalism, music, mythology, technology, and 2012 as a general framework to better understand and define the culture. 
Come join us, give us your opinion and help make a difference in the Universe.
print_description: Mitch Schultz and Charles Shaw share their new feature length documentary that focuses the lens at the nexus of the next-generation mystical revival.

title: Recycle your Aluminum Cans..!
description: Do you want to reduce the amount of recycling you will have to pack out? Great! Separate your aluminum cans and bring them to Black Rock City Recycle Camp!!! We are located in Center Camp at 6:00, directly behind the Cafe. The camp is "Open" and ready to accept your cans Monday through Sunday, 9am to 5pm. Bring your clean, separated aluminum cans only. We don't accept any other recyclables, you must pack them out. And we definitely don't want your trash. We provide a sorting area to check your cans for anything that isn't aluminum. Then you can ride the bike that powers the can crusher and crush your cans. After your cans get crushed, you will put your crushed cans into the large containers at the camp. All proceeds from the aluminum are donated to the Gerlach K-12 School in Gerlach, NV. Come join in the fun while doing a good thing for the planet and BRC..!
print_description: Do you want to reduce the amount of recycling you have to pack out? Great! Separate your aluminum cans & bring them to Black Rock City Recycle Camp!!!

title: Replay Cafe: Fresh Feedback Your Way
description:
Every day we receive feedback from friends, family, lovers, co-workers. Whether the feedback is relatively minor (after dinner a friend mentions that you've left a tip that is too small) to major (a parent expresses disapproval with your choice of partner), it often takes us by surprise. At some point, we've probably all wished we had reacted differently in a feedback situation. To get a do-over, a second chance, a fresh start - a replay!
 
And now you can! Stop by and choose from our menu of feedback scenarios. We'll act out the scene, then you're invited to imagine alternative strategies to improve the experience for the feedback giver or receiver. Join us on stage to put your ideas in action, or give us instructions for the replay. At our Replay Cafe, we serve fresh feedback your way!
print_description: Choose from our menu of dramatic situations, watch them enacted by cafe crew, and then imagine alternative responses and bring them to life on stage.

title: Return of the Goddess/Integrating the Feminine
description: Open forum discussion about the return of the Divine Feminine to our personal lives and society at large. What the impact of this return to balance will be and how we can fully receive Her. How this will affect Men and Women and our perceived roles in the world.

title: Revolutionary Honesty
description: This is not your everyday honesty, where you say the things you have safely preapproved for mass consumption, but the sticky gooey stuff it's hard to get out. We will model and practice together as a group with an eye for change in personal, political and social relationships.

title: Revolutionized Yoga: Structurally Integrated Yoga
description:
We practice yoga to create space in both our minds and our bodies. Through this workshop, we identify the areas where there is no space and together, we learn to let go of the restrictions that are preventing us from opening our hips, our heart and our mind.  

In this 2.5 hour workshop, students are facilitated to the discovery of their very own myofascial restrictions, and guided on how to release them. This is where the magic happens. This is the shift begins.

Ashley and Bryon work on an individual level to isolate the physical and emotional blockages that restrict us from achieving our full potential in each yoga posture. This revolutionizing approach to understanding the body will propel you years ahead in your yoga practice. Forget the eons of prep classes; you can meet your goals overnight. Revolutionized Yoga is the optimal solution for yoga practitioners that are craving a real, a rapid, a wild and a drastic shift in their yoga practice and their life.

Taught by Ashley Holly, MA, RYT and Bryon Brewster, CST, BCSI, MT, CHN, Osteopath, this workshop explores and shares the linkages between the connective tissue, fascia, movement and the asana.
print_description: Craving a real, a rapid, a wild and a drastic shift in your yoga practice? In your life? Learn to let go and propel you years ahead in your practice.

Gabrielle Penabaz, the Encouraging Priestess, performs a variation on her signature performance art piece, ‘TIL DEATH DO YOU PART – MARRY YOURSELF! title: Robot Lighting
description:
Dragun Giant Robot is the brainchild of Nick Myerhoff and Mike Parisi. They are a pair of misfit artist comrades who have been seeding the giant robot sculpture concept since 1995 when they worked together on the original Armymen video game at the now defunct 3DO Company. Nick was awarded the first Distrikt art grant in December 2011 and the robot grew in his back yard in Alameda over the ensuing months attracting a superstar build team: Mark Wagner, Ken Dahl, Daimon Marchant, Mike Parisi, Nick Myerhoff, Richard McDougall, Woodson Martin. The collective experience of the team ranges from Guinness Book of World Record art creators to silicon valley computer science executives and engineers.

Dragun is a 20’ tall full-scale stylized version of a 1970’s Shogun Warrior (known as Jumbo Machinder) made of recycled plastic. It is an interactive, large scale art sculpture with completely different night and day visual aesthetics. The robot is adorned with three types of interactivity; sound, light and movement. He is controlled by wifi, motion sensor and a cable pulley system. Many discussions have taken place around his gender and it is still unknown.

The robot is as tall as a house and weighs in at approximately 1000 lbs. His arms are made from Mango Chutney barrels and his legs are plastic water drums. Dragun's only metal part is his head, which is a wood burning stove. Dragun is made from 90% post consumer waste; he’s recycled! The robot took final shape in a single instant when Nick found the bright orange mail pallets (chest) and blue water barrels (legs) at the scrappy San Pablo salvage yard in Oakland late in 2011. 

Dragun will be on display at Distrikt camp from Monday August 27 through Monday September 3 at 9 o'clock and F, Black Rock desert. You are invited to attend a candle lighting ceremony on Monday August 27th at 9P.M. playa time. Come get a piece of him (plastic) in necklace form at the lighting.
print_description: Dragun is a giant 20' robot made of recycled plastic. Join us at Distrikt to see him lit up for the first time and meet the artists.

title: Sacred Community Architecture
description: Geo Frey, the architect of Red Lightning, offers a dynamic perspective on the art of building social and figural design from a permaculture background. I've been giving this talk the last few years at Red Lightning and it has always brought a great deal of affectionate attention.  With 27 years experience in Architectural studies and practice and being a co founder of an intentional community in Topanga, I have a unique perspective on these topics that people can tap into.

title: SACRED DANCE
description: Blossoming through all yet imperceptible to many lies sacredness, the true feminine principle of quiet thunder.  Long forgotten but recently rediscovered behind a fake wall in the White Cloud Monastery in China, 24 drawings of the Jade Maiden guide us back to the feminine practice of Qigong and our feminine essence.  Each one of us must balance and unite the male & female powers within, and  restore balance to the world. Come experience the movements of this Sacred Dance, deciphered from these drawings,  & awaken the feminine power within using this ancient wisdom.  All are welcome.

title: Sacred Geometry & Earth Energies of The Portals
description:
Sacred Geometry and Earth Energies of the Portals is an in depth presentation of the interactive “Portal” installations by Harlan Emil that employ sacred geometry, color and sound for participants to experience an evolution of consciousness. The golden ratio and the 5 platonic solids that are utilized in their designs will be described, plus the next level of geometries they manifest. It will be explained how the Portal’s designs incorporate the geometric evolution of the Earth’s interactive energy body and relate to the human chakra system.

Harlan Emil Gruber is a large-scale sculptural artist who merges his interests in art, design, and science into a unique body of work. He received a degree in Environmental Design from Parsons School of Design in 1985. His diverse career has included art furniture, sound sculpture, future habitation concepts, and large-scale interactive installations. His work has been exhibited in a variety of settings, from galleries in New York City and New Mexico, to the Black Rock desert in Nevada for the Burning Man festival. These installations are now being brought to a variety of events around the world.
print_description: An in depth presentation of interactive Portal installations by Harlan Emil that employ sacred geometry, color & sound for participants to experience.

title: Sapphire Sound Portal
description: The Sapphire Portal was inspired by concepts in The Emerald Modem: A Users Guide to the Earth’s Interactive Energy Body (2004). Author Richard Leviton describes etheric “blue dishes” under all sacred sites that collect subtle cosmic energies and distribute them into the earth and atmosphere. For Burning Man 2007 I designed a sky blue dish 61 feet in diameter and 9 1/2 feet high with sky blue carpet to physically manifest this idea while providing an environment of floating in the sky. In the center are three geometric forms that embody Leviton’s concept of an aspect of the Earth’s energy body evolving from its current geometric form to an icosidodecahedron. I built a half dodecahedron that houses the Quasar Wave Transducer sound sculpture that produces low frequency vibrations in the range of brain waves and earth resonance, and a half icosidodecahedron steel frame covered in stainless steel mirror triangles. These two shapes are shaded by a half icosahedron steel frame covered in aluminet shade cloth so that one may experience these shapes both day and night. A 30 foot section facing east was opened during sunrise. The Sapphire Portal acted as a personal, planetary and galactic vibrational alignemnent environment, providing profound experiences for many participants.
print_description: Come visist Harlan Emil Gruber's Sapphire interactive sound portal and be hypnotized by the sacred geometry, color and sound of it's toning hum.

title: Scribe on the future of Burning Man
description:
Fanning the Flame: A forum on the future of Burning Man culture

Is Burning Man still cool? How is the 27-year-old event's skyrocketing mainstream appeal changing burner culture? Can Black Rock City, that temporary desert city, really double in size to 100,000 citizens, as its founder envisions? Or is the future of this culture to be found off the playa, in cities around the world? And who will be calling the shots? 
Join Steven T. Jones – the Bay Guardian city editor and author of The Tribes of Burning Man: How an Experimental City in the Desert is Shaping the New American Counterculture – for a lively discussion of how this culture evolved and where it's headed. As one of the few journalists regularly working the Burning Man beat, he offers an inside yet independent perspective on this country's preeminent countercultural institution and its role in modern American life.
print_description: Forum with Scribe, aka Steven T. Jones, author of The Tribes of Burning Man: How an Experimental City in the Desert is Shaping the New
