title: Sensual Exploration and Empowerment through Dance
description:
Join us for an experiential dance journey held in the vibrancy of the 5 Rhythms, SheddingSkins and Dancing Freedom movement practices.

We will begin by discovering our sensual expression slowly from the inside...finding that center point of self-love and self-care and allowing it to grow from our heart center out into the physical, exploring from fingertips to belly to toes how to cultivate this feeling inside while inviting it to be present outside. 

From here we will reveal how to extend that dance to the space around us and (always in clear choice, never pushing beyond out own place of 'yes') then how to connect it with others, discovering how connecting affects our own dance, that of another and of the space between us...how to honor and care for self, invite sensual expression with others and allow each to be witnessed and held in that sweet dance of our authentic self which is ever connected, rooted and free. 

About Your Facilitators: 

Eugene Hedlund is a certified 5 Rhythms teacher and the founder of the SheddingSkins path of personal transformation. He is based in San Diego, California and teaches both 5 Rhythms and SheddingSkins workshops throughout the US and in Europe. 

The SheddingSkins path is a seamless blend of Movement Meditation, Sound Alchemy, Shamanic Ritual and Tantric Ceremony into one cohesive practice where each of these medicines are used to create a comprehensive system of personal transformation. 

www.sheddingskins.com 

Tessabella is a Massage Therapist and spiritual dance practitioner who has found great passion, grounding and healing in movement. Dance is both a therapy and a celebration for her. She loves the magic, power and immensity of the transformation and awakening she experiences in herself and others through movement.
print_description: Join us for an experiential dance born from the space between us and held in the vibrancy of the 5Rhythms, SheddingSkins and Dancing Freedom practices

title: Sexploration! A Gender Blender Play Party
description:
Get your Sexploration on! Its time to get hot and sexy with other fabulous gender queer, trans, and queer folks.

This party is a safe space for trans, gender queer, gender variant, queer, open minded, unidentified folks to get their freak on. Sexy, hot, & off the hook. We practice safer sex and in order to play you must also. This party is designed with queer folks in mind. It is specifically a safe space for gender blenders, gender benders, trans, and gender questioning folks. It also is a safe space for cis-gendered queer folks. Feel free to bring toys, condoms, gloves, lube, and cute people - of course we will also be providing. Consent in our Gender Blender dome is a must. Keep it safe, sane, and consensual. We take our consent and safety seriously, if you are not interested in fun safe play, don't show up. If you can't play safely then you can't play in our dome. If you are ready for an amazing fabulous glittery kickin play party then this is the spot for you! All levels of play are welcome from first timers to sexperts. Respect in our dome is paramount. We are creating a unique space that is not found anywhere else on playa. This party is for people of all genders with a priority on creating safety for communities that are normally marginalized or exoticized. We can't wait to see your hotness shine at this phenomenal event.
All genders welcome all ways.

title: Socially Appropriate Boner Day
description: Today, if you get a boner, you get to keep it--for as long as it wants to be a boner. Grow it naturally, or strap it on. You don't have to suppress it just so someone doesn't judge you for being a pig or get jealous because it's not for her or him. Today it's okay to have just woken up in the morning, okay to be stimulated by your own silky boxers, and okay to be TURNED ON, because you have a right to your feelings and you get to do whatever you want with your body.

title: Socially Appropriate Burp Day
description: What's the big deal? Burping is fun and it's free! Who gets to decide the acceptableness of burping? You do! Just for today, let all burping be considered socially appropriate. Buuuuuuuurp!!!!
print_description: What's the big deal? Burping is fun and it's free! Who gets to decide the acceptableness of burping? You do! Buuuuuuuurp!!!

title: Socially Appropriate Eat-With-Your-Mouth-Open Day
description: Did you know that the more oxygenated your food is, the better you taste it? That's why ice cream tastes better with a fork than with a spoon. And that's why our natural inclination is to eat with our mouths open. What's the big deal about what it looks like? You're willing to put it in your mouth and chew but you're not willing to look at it? That's like a carnivore who's unwilling to kill their own cow. So, go ahead and taste what you've been missing—today you can eat with your mouth OPEN!
print_description: Did you know that the more oxygenated your food is, the better you taste it? That's why ice cream tastes better with a fork than with a spoon.

title: Socially Appropriate Fart Day
description: It's not like you have to pack it out or anything. You don't even have to go down the block with a spare roll of toilet paper. Just do it right where you are. It's time to celebrate our farts and acknowledge that it's about time we got over that harmless smell. What's the big deal? You're human for christsake! Today you can feel free to fart any old time as loudly and as smellily as you want!
print_description: It's not like you have to pack it out or anything. Today you can feel free to fart any old time as loudly and as smellily as you want!

title: Socially Appropriate Menstruation Day
description: Hey, menstruation is totally natural—you don't have to be embarrassed just because you have a naturally occurring blood flow. Give yourself permission to go without a tampon or pad for once. Wear white pants with no underwear. Embrace freedom! Let the blood make its artistic mark! Today is the day to feel like a natural Womyn!!!
print_description: Hey, menstruation is totally natural—skip the pad and tampon for once. Wear white pants with no underwear. Let the blood make its artistic mark!

title: Socially Appropriate Nose Picking Day
description: Who wants to suffer with a bunch of dried up gunk and crust in their nose? Get those dried up playa boogers out of there already! Don't worry if anyone's watching you go deep with that index finger! Why not give that thumb a try! It's time for each of us to get the relief we deserve and to breathe just a little freer. And go ahead, flick it on the ground because that's where that stuff came from.
print_description: Don't suffer with a bunch of dried up gunk and crust in your nose. Go ahead and have the relief you deserve and breathe just a little freer.

title: Socially Appropriate Yawn Day
description: Hey, it's been a long, fun week. Everyone knows you're tired. We're all tired too. You don't have to suppress that yawn today. That's right—celebrate one of the great mammalian mysteries and let out a big old yawn even when someone is talking right at you. No need to suppress today because today is Socially Appropriate Yawn Day!

title: Song, Dust, Sing: Singer Songwriter Open Showcase
description: Song, Dust, Sing...hosted by Reverbia (All Live Music Camp)...provides the setting for one of the most popular open mic, singer/songwriter showcases happening in Black Rock City.  Each day, 14-16 Artists will usually ride in from the desert, with instrument on their back and dust on their boots, hoping to scribe their name for one of the few cherished slots available at this unique, 2 song and out, 90 minute long...singer/songwriter showcase.  Expectations are soon fulfilled for both the large attentive audience and the performing artist...as the sound system amplifies quality and the Reverbia Embassy Shade Structure provides the necessary cool space...to evoke chilled out vibes, for a long hot afternoon.  Visit us once, twice, or everyday for this unique sampler of singer/songwriter talent...and support Live Music at Burning Man.

title: “Songs of the Hearts on Fire”
description:
A performance piece towards the experience of a collaborative action painting. A large canvas is set on the ﬂoor, as a stage. It is an invitation to dance with paint. To ground the experience into the canvas with sweat and laughing feet. Two performance pieces, one hour each. After the event, the canvas is laid out to dry, cut up in pieces and showcased at the camp. Each piece is marked with the title of the song, a quote, and a technical note. A follow-up party is intended to give out a piece of the painting to all of the participants.

David Black and Elizabeth Romo.
print_description: Come dance with others on a canvas and paint with your feet. Turn your movements into communal art that will be cut up and gifted after the dance!

title: So You Think You're Hot?
description: The now infamous camp challenge is back. With origins dating all the way back to the 1980s, this camping tradition has morphed into something truly monstrous. During the heat of the day, in triple digit temperatures, one must eat a helping of five-alarm chili, cooked with the dreaded Guatemalan insanity pepper (grown only by the inmates of a Guatemalan insane asylum). Then, to wash it down, a shot of hot pepper vodka, also infused with the same insanely hot pepper. Now, when you want nothing more than an ice-cold beverage to quench the fire burning in your mouth, you instead must chug a cheap, warm beer that's been sitting out in the sun since daybreak. Why, might you ask, would anyone want to do this? Hell if we know! It's a terrible idea! It's a horrible thing to conceive, much less do on purpose! Yet, as demonstrated by the droves of people who participated AND completed the challenge in 2009 and 2010, we apparently underestimated human nature. Not only did crowds show up for the challenge, but they returned over the course of the week to to share the pain with their friends. And by share, we mean point and laugh while grown men cried and stumbled down the street in a daze. We even had a university anthropologist come hangout, just to observe this odd aspect of human behavior.  We're bringing it back spicier than ever for 2012!
print_description: The Challenge - Can you handle the heat? Super spicy vodka, spicy evil chili, and ...warm beer???  Are you hot enough?

title: So, you want to be a SLUT?
description: This workshop is for those considering consensual non-monogamy, those practicing it, and those just curious. We will define consensual non-monogamy and differentiate it from other relationship styles. We will share our experiences in the consensual non-monogamy world. Styles of consensual non-monogamy discussed include open relations, swinging, polyamory, polifidelity, and single but non-monogamous. We will discuss how we deal with jealousy, as well as some risks. Most of all we will try to answer whatever questions you may have.
print_description: Workshop on non-monogamy such as open relations, swinging, polyamory, polifidelity, & single/non-monogamous. How to deal with jealousy & other risks

We will define consensual non-monogamy and differentiate it from other relationship styles. We will share our experiences in the consensual non-monogamy world. Styles of consensual non-monogamy discussed include open relations, swinging, polyamory, polifidelity, and single but non-monogamous. We will discuss how we deal with jealousy, as well as some risks. Most of all we will try to answer whatever questions you may have.
print_description: Workshop on non-monogamy such as open relations, swinging, polyamory, polifidelity, & single/non-monogamous. How to deal with jealousy & other risks

title: Spirituality for Atheists
description: In "Religion for Atheists" Alain de Botton argues that "rather than mocking religions, agnostics and atheists should instead steal from them – because they're packed with good ideas on how we might live and arrange our societies." This discussion is about distilling the tools of religions from the dogmas that surround them. (Don't don't throw out the baby with the holy water!) Rather than trying to cover this whole topic in a single workshop, the goal will be to introduce the general concepts while facilitating the sharing of resources (books, articles, quotes, etc.) for people to explore on their own. Please bring something to share.
print_description: This discussion is about distilling the tools of religions from the dogmas that surround them. Please bring something to share.

title: Speakers' Corner
description: Like London's Speakers' Corner with a Burner twist, come to speak, hear, or provide counterpoint. Bring your prejudices and leave them at the SOAPBOX. Topics to discuss. Tuesday 7-8 PM: The Best Democracy Money Can Buy (Agree we have a great Democratic Republic? Believe in Free Enterprise and Libertarianism?) Tuesday 8-9 PM: Poetry, Limericks, Jokes. Priority to poetry.Wednesday 7-8 PM: Open Mic (speak your piece). Wednesday 8-9 PM: BRC events (What are you/your camp offering) OR Tea Party, Truth Party, Taxes.

title: Spiritual Meaning of "Dust" & "Desert" in Judaism
description: Dust and Desert surround us and inspire us in magical and surprising ways at Burning Man. These also happen to be rich, recurring images in Jewish tradition. We were originally created out of dust and we all eventually return to dust, and dust in the wind is a profound reflection of the human condition. Desert is the site of revelation and the unknown, and it is the liminality where we wander between narrowness and wholeness. We'll look at some texts from the Torah, from the ancient Sages, and from modern Jewish thought. And, together, we'll also look inward and outward in new ways.
print_description: Come and learn how the motifs of “dust” and “desert” in Jewish tradition shed light on what it means to be human and what it means to seek the divine.

title: Straight Shaving and Pipe Smoking
description: Straight Shaving and Pipe Smoking.   Once upon a time, men smoked pipes and shaved with straight razors.  Camp DIY wants to make pipe smoking cool again and take back our power from the 5 blade razor! Attend a workshop hosted by Kevin, a recent convert to pipe smoking and straight razor shaving, where he shows you what he's learned about both.  Unlike the olden times, pipe smoking and straight razor shaving will be open to women, but Kevin claims no knowledge of what a women can do with her straight razor and accepts no liability.  We welcome old time pipe smokers and/or straight razor users to join us for the camaraderie (pipe smoking allowed but no smirking at us newbies). Bring your pipes and/or the  paraphernalia you use to sharpen your blade. Show and Tell from workshop participants on techniques follows presentation.
print_description: Camp DIY wants to make pipe smoking cool again and take back our power from the 5 blade razor! Welcome old timer to share tips.

title: Surprise Party!
description: Do you remember the first time you were surprised by your closest friends with a party ? Sure, it may have been a little scary at first but that’s all part of the thrill before you realize how everyone is there to celebrate you! Two campmates will venture out and use any silly excuse to get lucky random people to come into camp while the rest hide and remain quiet. Upon entering, we will all jump out and yell “Surprise!” while the DJ turns up the volume, signalling the start of some of the most outrageous dancing on the playa. After a short time, we repeat the procedure, inviting more and more Burners into the ultimate dance party.  Party theme: multiplicity!

title: Sweat Your Prayers at RhythmWave
description:
"The quickest way to still the mind is to move the body." ~ Gabrielle Roth

The 5Rhythms is an in-bodied, out of your mind  dance experience not to be missed. It is a simple, powerful moving meditation that anyone – of any age, size, or physical ability - can practice. There are no steps to follow, no choreography to learn, no way to do it wrong. The only requirement is a body that is still breathing, a heart that is still beating, and mind that is still curious! 

Just like light, sound or ocean waves, a dancing body when moving freely passes through five distinct rhythmic patterns. These patterns continuously repeat themselves in a wave of motion.

The 5Rhythms are:

FLOWING – the fluid, continuous, grounded glide of our own movements

STACCATO – the percussive, pulsing beat that shapes us a thousand different ways

CHAOS – the rhythm of letting go, releasing into the catalytic wildness of our dance that can never be planned or repeated

LYRICAL – the rhythm of trance, where the weight of self-consciousness dissolves, where we lighten up and disappear into our own uniqueness

STILLNESS – the quiet emptiness, where gentle movements rise and fall, start and end, in a field of silence

Please join RhythmWave as we return to the Black Rock City for our sixth year with this gorgeous dance/meditation practice that we love to share with you!
print_description: 5Rhythms on a shaded bamboo floor-an in-bodied, out-of-your mind conscious dance experience not to be missed. No experience needed, just an open heart

title: SynchroniciTea Workshop
description:
From Chaos to Cosmic Coincidence.

Grab a cuppa, say hi to Ouroboros and jump aboard the fractal express, a galactic voyage through the archetypes to infinity and back; from mythology to chaos theory. Follow the white rabbit on a journey through the mandalic world of cosmic coincidence, open the door to lady serendipity and invite her in for a pot of freshly brewed synchronici-tea.

Take a stroll into the infinite corridor of chaos and discover the self recursive nature of reality from humans to dark matter. This workshop will unravel the fractal geometry of our universe and allow you to witness the organic structures that grow straight out of the abyss - in the words of Douglas Hofstadter:

“It turns out that an eerie type of chaos can lurk just behind a facade of order - and yet, deep inside the chaos lurks an even eerier type of order.”

Just a coincidence? Our lives tend to orchestrate a storyline filled with bizarre synchronicities and connections seemingly beyond explanation, however most are unaware of the extent that our cosmos reflects this characteristic. Ever wondered why the moon and the sun appear to be the same size from Earth? From the atom to the solar system, in this workshop we take a look into the truly unbelievable level of serendipity inherent in our universe.
print_description: Fractal journeys from chaos to cosmic coincidence; an open invitation for lady serendipity to come in for a pot of freshly brewed synchronici-tea.

SynerG is thrilled to host our annual Gala at Reverbia Camp on Tuesday night. Come, bask in our lush decor & lighting, and snuggle in our cushy cush...and join the jam session that's taking the playa by STORM! 

Come play our instruments, or bring your own!  Play, sing along, grab a shaker, heckle, whistle, dance, snooze or sit and watch. Up to you!

title: Tango Class
description:
Learn how to partner dance with Tangoed up in Blues (Monday-Thursday).  We teach tango and blues classes, follow them up with practice time, then happy hour (often with live music), and dances in the evenings.  Tango milongas are Monday and Wednesday, Blues dances on Tuesday and Thursday.

In our classes, you'll learn how to do these two social partner dances, how to connect with the music and your partner, how to relax, you'll get to meet and interact with your playa brethren, and you'll dance a bunch.

During the guided practice time, you'll have a chance to practice during the day and ask questions of the experienced dancers hanging out.

At happy hour, grab a drink, dance and chill. Listen to live music if we have a drop-in musician (or let us know if you you'd like to play some blues or tango music at our camp).

And then in the evening, dress up, and come dance the night away.  We keep the music running at all hours.
print_description: Learn how to partner dance with Tangoed up in Blues.  We teach tango and blues classes and host dances in the evenings.

title: TEDxBlackRockCity
description:
Nothing new can emerge without first a coming together. Creation - in all of its infinite forms - requires an encounter: of people, of materials, of ideas. Everything was born of relations - of chemistry and community, of labor and love. Every single thing.

This simple truth poses important questions: if everything is born from a cauldron of relations — from whence comes the spark? And might not some types of relations prove more an obstacle to creativity than its fertile soup? Answers to these questions could in turn help us to answer perhaps the most important question of all: How can we create a more creative world?

On Thursday August 30, 2012, TEDxBlackRockCity seeks to investigate the nature of creativity and possibilities of its fluorescence.

Black Rock City — or Burning Man — the largest intentional community on earth, and one of the world’s most vibrantly creative places, will provide an especially powerful setting for this investigation. On its most basic level, TEDxBlackRockCity will provide a stage for some of Burning Man’s most visionary inhabitants to speak about their ideas and their creations. On a deeper level, it will draw on the very values of Burning Man, whose Ten Principles (radical inclusion, gifting, de-commodification, radical, self-reliance, radical self-expression, communal effort, civic responsibility, leaving no trace, participation, and immediacy) will provide touchstones for the speakers in their talks.

Indeed, it is in the spirit of three of these Principles: Inclusion, Communality and Participation, that TEDxBlackRockCity aims to be more than merely a staged performance. For it is intended, above all, to foster creativity among all of its remarkable participants — both on stage and off — drawing on the uniquely dynamic community of Burning Man to concoct an exemplar of that fertile soup churning with creative sparks.

TEDxBlackRockCity will take place on August 30, 2012 at 1PM, located at Play)A(Skool —9:45 & Esplanade.
print_description: TEDxBlackRockCity investigates the nature of creativity and possibilities of its fluorescence. Ideas into action. TEDxBRC will PRO:CREATE. Join us.

title: The Bonobo Lodge
description:
A private event space for explorations of primate-inspired community where grooming plays a vital role in the formation of social bonds. This is a clothes-free environment; the space is gently heated at night for comfort. If you’re interested in attending or would like to know more, you’re encouraged to visit during open hours, have a look at the space, and meet the hosts.

House Rules:
+ adults only, no one under 18 is allowed
+ no penetration, not even open-mouth kissing
+ ask first, yes means yes, no means no
+ participation is expected, within your limits

Open daily!
Mornings, 9am – 11am
Afternoons, 4pm – 6pm
Evenings, 10pm – Midnight

title: The Countless Carrot March
description:
Hello All Ye peasants, pheasants, rock stars, chalk boards, monsters, mongers, burners and yearners. 

Are you ready for a party that will turn your socks orange, turn your mind upside down and turn your liver into a champion! 

Come join the Carrots while they march into the sunset against those pesky bunnies. NO BUNNIES ALLOWED. ALL OTHERS WELCOME. 


CHANTS
DANCES
BINGES 
FREDDY MER-CARROT-Y
BUNNIES WALKING THE PLANK
SALAD SONGS
CARROT PRAYER 
CARROT MIXED DRINKS
DECORATIONS 
THE FARMER AND THE CARROT DELL
MUSIC 
WONDERS 
YOU

Come one ye all! And MARCH THROUGH ENDLESS THYME...into SOUPER WONDROUS CARROT HEAVEN.

Hey and if you feel like giving please help the Carrots and their family so we can continue to have excellent marches and healthy vegetables every year! Check it out! 
http://www.indiegogo.com/blackrockcityfarmersmarket
print_description: Join the Carrots pre-party as they march to stand against the tyrannical bunnies. Drinks, Songs, Veggies, FUN! NO BUNNIES ALLOWED. ALL OTHERS WELCOME

title: The Crystal Cavern
description:
By night, indulge yourself in transcendent experience as you enter 
another world within The Crystal Cavern. Surrounded by two story 
fluorescent crystals, vividly colored mushrooms, and silk mandalas, enjoy live and recorded music - mandolin, shamanic icaros, world beat, down tempo, and at least one night of psytrance. Come lounge on the soft, fluffy pillows and absorb our ambiance, light shows, and music.

By day, our comfortable 40-foot dome hosts the Palenque Norte Speaker Series (see separate listing). Enjoy presentations from leaders in the visionary, entheogenic, and psychedelic communities.

In the morning, bring your yoga mat and join us for morning and evening community yoga practice in our yoga area. Leave the dust behind and expand your body and mind.
print_description: Visually striking 40’ dome lounge with giant fluorescent crystals, mushrooms, fluffy pillows. Live & recorded music–down tempo, world beat, psytrance.

title: The dance of the sword

print_description: Learn the movements and grace of traditional swordplay. Wooden practice swords provided. Get a good stretch and have some Fun!

title: THE DECENTRALIZED DANCE PARTY!
description:
The Decentralized Dance Party is a portable, battery-powered Party system, with no Central audio source and no Central location.

It consists of hundreds of Party People, carrying vintage boomboxes, and a DJ who wears a backpack, containing a powerful FM transmitter.

All the boomboxes are tuned into the DJ’s master FM broadcast, resulting in a mobile, synchronized sound system. This Portable Dance Party roams the night, generating complete awesomeness, street by street and block by block, onto buses and subways, into public fountains and beyond. Inevitably interfacing with the public, together we create an infectious epidemic of fun. A Roaming Party Adventure that lasts all night long!

And the Decentralized Dance Party (DDP) is headed to Burning Man for the first time in 2012.

The plan is to throw a massive, Playa-wide DDP and create a Primeval Party Moment more powerful than all which have come before.

It’s likely to be a very good time.

THE PLAN:
Together, we will create a free-roaming, Open-Source-themed DDP, powered by over 150 synchronized boomboxes, guerrilla sound systems and art cars that will explore and interact with as many other art structures and theme camps as possible, in a full-throttle adventure that rages all over the Playa, from sunset to sunrise!

It will commence on Thursday August 30th, at 7:30, at the feet of the MAN, as the sun is setting and conclude twelve hours later, as the full moon Reaches Its Apex and the sun begins to rise on Friday morning...

Bring your own boombox, or borrow one from the 150 we will be lending out.


ALL THE DETAILS ON HOW TO PARTICIPATE AND CONTRIBUTE AND ENJOY ARE RIGHT HERE: http://bit.ly/PrnJ7b
print_description: The DDP consists of hundreds of Party People, carrying vintage boomboxes, and a DJ who wears a backpack, containing a powerful FM transmitter.

title: The Great Phallic Poetry Slam
description:
Poets! Storytellers! Troubadours! Ever wanted to spout your verse from atop a giant phallus? well, here's your golden opportunity! 

Come along to Baal-Mart's Great Phallic Poetry Slam! We will be in need of both competitors to fight to the wordy death and raucus and enthusiastic audience members to cheer them along. Judges will be randomly selected out of the audience. 

Be there early to sign up as space will be limited in the slam. 

There will be two rounds. 

3 minute time limit.
No music unless you're a wicked beatboxer. 
Costumes ok (this is Burning Man!).
Original material encouraged.

In case of a tie, we go to sudden death Haiku Battle! 

See you and your awe inspiring rhymes on Tuesday 2pm, for your chance to be crowned the Baal-Mart Great Phallic Slam Champion!

title: The Great Work  - Holy Guardian Angel
description:
The Great Work  - Knowledge and Conversation with the Holy Guardian Angel

Aleister Crowley believed Knowledge and Conversation with one’s Holy Guardian Angel should be the preeminent goal of every magician. This experience has been described as the Great Work wherein the microcosm and macrocosm merge together producing transformative change in the life of the initiate. The yearning for thisSummum Bonum has been described by St. Augustine of old who wrote of god that “our heart is restless until it finds its rest in thee.” Join us as we explore the centrality of Knowledge and Conversation from the perspective of Thelema and how this most sacred of doctrines can impact your life.
print_description: Aleister Crowley believed Knowledge and Conversation with one’s Holy Guardian Angel should be the preeminent goal of every magician. Learn More!

title: The Heart of Now
description:
The essence of the Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. In The Heart of Now workshop, you’ll come to know yourself more deeply. You’ll discover the possibility of reconnection with your innate beauty, wholeness and be honest with yourself and and with others in a safe circle of love. You can discover those places you’ve felt stuck, while you are supported in letting go. You learn to become aware of those times when you get in your own way, and come to see the choices open to you. You embrace what you desire the most, and deeply commit to letting your dreams and your visions be more important than you past wounds. You will find yourself reconnecting with your innate beauty, wholeness and power in each moment.

Heart of Now workshops include numerous assistants to support you and to create a sacred space for transformation. A deeply nurturing environment is created. This teamwork approach deepens the experience of service and camaraderie, where all are able to experience their vulnerabilities, allowing trust and growth. For questions visit our website www.HeartOfNow.org.
print_description: The essence of the Heart of Now is the practice of being present with your whole self. You’ll come to know yourself more deeply.

title: The Mediocre Race 2012!
description:
See what happens when The Velvet Rut lowers the bar and takes Mediocrity to an all new level with the Mediocre Race 2012: Race Against Time to the End of the Line! 

Who knows what surprise adventures await or what special skills may be tested.  

No experience necessary, silliness guaranteed! 

Sign up as a team. No partner – no problem; we’ll partner you up! 

Make your way to the Velvet Rut Camp to sign-up from 12:00pm to 12:30pm Tuesday through Friday.  You can check the day's schedule at the same time and prepare yourselves for the awesomeness that will ensue! 

Closing ceremonies, featuring smooth beats with velvety treats, will take place on Friday after the last race event has completed.

title: The Mighty Boosh Is On The Loose!
description:
Once, I planned an event where a bunch would get together and watch episodes of "The Mighty Boosh." That was July the 2nd, Nine'een-seventy-nine, the day The Funk died. Two weeks later, I found The Funk in bed with Dr. LeTawdry and a conger eel. At first, I thought it was a sea anemone, but under closer inspection, I realized it was a funky balls o' tits from outer space! I'm Old Gregg.

Thanks to George Clinton and a Himalayan sherpa with a choice DVD collection and a bad case of dermatitis, The Mighty Boosh comes to the Playa, where Old Gregg and The Hitcher tend to frequent. Who knows what will happen, but it's guaranteed to be epic! I'm Old Greggggggggg!!
print_description: Come drink Baileys from a shoe. Bring your own damn shoe! Watch choice Boosh episodes! Come dressed as your favorite, or least favorite, character!

title: The Million Waldo March
description: Let there be no more inconspicuousness for the world's red-and-white- striped travelers: stand up and be found at the Million Waldo March! Meet at Where's Waldo? Camp in your glasses and stripes for a highly conspicuous march out to the Man. All Waldos, Wendas, Wizards and Odlaws are welcome. No stripes? No problem. Come by Where's Waldo? Camp on Thursday between 3 and 4, and we'll get you properly attired. Afterward, join your fellow Waldos at Where's Waldo? Camp for a Waldo meet-and-greet.
print_description: Stand up and be found at the Million Waldo March. Stripes of all colors welcome.  Meet at Where's Waldo Camp afterward for the Waldo Meet and Greet.

title: The Misting Dome
description: Cool off in the Misting Dome, your oasis in the Black Rock Desert! Soothe yourself under the 10 powerful misting jets filled with pure Sierra snowmelt, obtained from a 9000 ft mountain spring. After your mist, head over to our adjacent Oasis Lounge and relax in the shade with a glass of wine or water.  When the sun sets, misting ends and the black lights come on, illuminating the beautiful "River of Time" mural. The Poi pond comes alive with hula hoopers, poi spinners and light background music.  This will be the Misting Dome's last year on the playa. Stop by and celebrate a great 2012 with us!
print_description: Celebrate the Misting Dome's last year on the playa! We're bringing 800 gallons of pure Sierra snowmelt for misting; don't make us take any home!

title: The Pink Path-A Burning Man Transformation Tale
description: "Exalting in the now is the most profound spiritual experience you can get."  Find out how and why with the Black Rock City Premiere of "The Pink Path-A Burning Man Transformation Tale" produced by John Halcyon Styn and filmed by film maker Jake Tison. Q&A after the film with Halcyon, co-founder of Pink Heart. Pink Brownies will be served.  At Videogasm, 8:15 & Edelweiss in Snowflake Village.
print_description: "Exalting in the now is the most profound spiritual experience you can get."

title: The New World Manifesto!
description: We are on a mission for creative and consciousness-awakening ideas for the ‘New World’. The Mayan prophesy states that we are approaching the end of an age in 2012 – this is a time of transition from one World Age into another. The message they give concerns our choice of how we enter the future ahead. How we cross this threshold will determine how we transition into the coming age.The American nation has already seen a taste of what is to come from other nations, with a gradual decline in standards, increased unemployment and the real-estate and industrial collapse. Coinciding with the ending of the Mayan calendar in December 2012, we feel there is an increased public focus on world events which acts as a catalyst for major change.This project documents the progression of the fulfillment of our objective – collecting entries for The New World Manifesto. Contributions to the manifesto will be personally delivered to the ‘Gods of the Elements’ in Chichen Itza on the 21st December 2012.We are bringing the question to you; How do you want to enter this new age? This project is designed so that people from around the world can contribute to the Manifesto. We will be:-Creating an online documentary series, event log and blog of our voyage.-Uploading content daily that you can comment on and participate in.-Searching for contributors for our ‘new world manifesto’.-Interviewing people from a cross-section of American society.-Filming the ‘making-of’ documentary feature film for release in Feb. 2013.The story is narrated by five leading characters - a cabaret performer, a reporter, an actor, a cook and an artist. They will be Accompanied by the 3 crew members, the cinematographers / photographers.In each documentary episode, the interviewees will be asked about their vision of the ‘New World’ and will be offered the opportunity to enter their wishes into The Manifesto. We are all creating our future right now! So let's do it together!
print_description: Share the experience of the New World Manifesto Documentary series. Watch the videos nightly and share in a lively discussion & envision our future

title: Theophony Burn
description: Monks chant and fire spins before the Theophony yurt transforms from a pillar of cloud to a pillar of fire.
print_description: Monks chant and fire spins before the Theophony yurt transforms from a pillar of cloud to a pillar of fire.

title: The Orgasamator Experience
description: The Orgasamator is back, at the Camp for Sensual Pleasures. The Orgasmatron had been a fixture at Burning Man for many years, giving thousands of women extreme physical pleasure in an environment that was very safe, comfortable and private. Two years ago we took everything we had learned and completely redesigned the machine for even greater intensity and enjoyment, and we gave it a new name: The Orgasamator. You may have seen it at Spanky’s Wine Bar. This year we’ve taken it that much further with a singular goal of maximizing our guests’ overall pleasure, along with the comfort and sensuality of the environment. When you visit, you will be in a private room with an operator who is experienced, very sensitive to your needs and concerns, and deeply dedicated to giving you an amazing experience in an environment that is safe, comfortable and private, and which leaves you feeling completely respected and in control. Come solo, or better yet, bring a good friend (male or female) to add another dimension to this deeply immersive and personal experience. You can wear as much or as little as you would like while riding this marvelous machine, and you can stop any time if the pleasure becomes too intense. If you are a woman, the Orgasamator Experience at our I-Scream Parlour is something you won't want to miss. Visit us at the Camp for Sensual Pleasures, in Spanky’s Village, and also ask about The Pope’s Massage & Hair washing.
print_description: We've upgraded our well-known Orgasmatron this year to give women even more intense physical pleasure, in an environment that's safe and comfortable.

title: The Punjabi Dating Game
description: Remember "The Dating Game", that truly awful television show from the 1960s where a couple of losers and one decent fellow would try and win the hand of some deserving bachelorette?  Yeah, stupid I know.  Well, your friends from Barbie Death Village and our subcontinental themecamp BollyVille will be hosting India's own version: The Punjabi Dating Game!  We need three eligable bachelors (or even more because there's enough of Ninzy to handle Gunga Din's personal hoardes) and come Friday evening before The Wall Street Burn out on the deep playa we will be hosting our show.  Complete with playa-sanctioned pyrotechnics, our 45 minute show will be an eye-popping experience indeed.  Head out beyond the Temple and look for the 21st Century version of The Dating Game set, pull up a chair, and get your curry on.  The winning bachelor and Ninzy will be whisked away in our very own Barbie's Mobile Whorehouse in plush comfort, complete with champagne and minions to act like sycophants to their very beck and call, and escorted to The Wall Street Burn.  Afterwards the lovely couple will come back to Barbie Death Camp to perhaps consumate their date.  Or not.  You never know for sure but one thing is certain:  A splendid time is guaranteed for all.
print_description: Any of you men from India?  We have a really cute, very well-endowed young Indian lady in search for her Prince Charming.  Punjabi single men only.

title: There Is Enough Of Everything For Everyone – A Pan
description: There is an unlimited or nearly unlimited supply of everything we could need or want (water, food, love, value, sex, happiness).  The single biggest obstacle between us and living in a world where this is apparent to everyone is the meme of scarcity and our belief in its existence.  For those of us on the edge of truly surrendering to an abundance mindset, truly walking through the world as fully resourced people, how do we take the last few steps for ourselves and each other?  This panel discusses pragmatic methods of transferring from scarcity to abundance in any context for ourselves and those around us.
print_description: Surrender to an abundance mindset - Pragmatic methods of transferring from scarcity to abundance in any context for ourselves and those around us.

title: The Salon at Summer Camp Sync. @ Sundown
description:
A smorgasbord of performance art, music, and spoken word. Bring your  5 -10 min performance to share. Or participate in the Battle of Words hip hop and spoken word slam down. Come early if you have special tech requests. On Playa collaborations and works in progress encouraged. Bear Margaritas for all!!

The Salon is a night of creative expression. Our community started hosting salons in January 2010 as a safe space for the folks of Synchronicity and our friends to share finished or unfinished works of art, poetry, song, or any form of creative release.  The idea was to encourage people in the community to create, share, and hear thoughts or ideas from fellow creative souls.  It has since expanded, and we have enjoyed works of musicians, poets, storytellers, palindromists, historians, novelists, ramblers, gamblers, painters, filmmakers, drunks, fathers, mothers, lovers, dreamers, and psychedelic clowns from all over this land!
A crowd of lovely folks from across the playa will be gathering at 7.30 pm in preparation for the night's event.  A list will be roaming around, with 20 spots to fill. As 8 pm nears, we pile in front of our stage and are greeted by the lovely host of the evening.  From there.. anything goes!
print_description: Come to Camp Sync for a wonderful evening of community and creativity. Artists are invited to share their hearts/talents. Join the artistic reverie!

title: The Sammie Wagon
description:
You look tired 'hun. Sit down and let me make you a sammie.

The SammieWagon is a pedal-powered mobile 50's kitchen that brings you a touch of home and a yummy grilled cheese sandwich on the playa.

If our stylish kitsch wagon chooses you as a victim, a beehived housewife and pipe puffing patriarch will sit you down and ask you how your day's been while we make you a delicious cheese sandwich at a table for one.  Before you can stop to remember what decade it is, the wagon disappears into a dust cloud, leaving you wonder if you even ate a sandwich at all, or if it was just your sun addled brain feeding you delicious imagery of a bygone era.
print_description: Sit down 'hun, I'm gonna make you a sammie. Our mobile 50's kitchen will be dispensing love, kitsch, and grilled cheese all around the playa Mon-Sat.

title: The Saraswati Tea House
description:
The Saraswati Tea House offers fine teas and herbal infusions served in the Chinese Gong Fu tea tradition. The Tea House is a refuge where guests can rest, rehydrate and have quiet conversations. The tea ceremony provides stillness in the midst of chaos. All are welcome at the tea tables where servers offer compassionate hospitality and moist towelettes to refresh journeying visitors.

The Saraswati Tea House has both indoor and outdoor lounge spaces serving tea and providing an oasis for visitors who need a place to reflect on the ebb and flow of their personal cosmic journey. Tended day and night by our gentle tea servers, we honor Saraswati, the Hindu Goddess of Cosmic Knowledge, by welcoming those who need respite, insight, and a kind word during their passage towards wisdom and evolved consciousness. You are welcome to rest and reflect at the Saraswati Tea House during your transformation and initiation.
print_description: A tranquil lounge providing fine teas and herbal infusions in the Chinese Gong Fu tradition for those needing rest, rehydration, and conversation.

print_description: Explore sound-science and discover the open source technology of the SoundPuddle art installation. Live acoustic music and spectral visualizations

title: THE SOULPLEX - LIVE SOUL FUNK BAND PARTY
description:
Zen as Fuck turns into Zen as Funk as 
we bring some soul to BRC with the SOULPLEX, a live music venue and groove factory. Inspired by the soultrain, we felt the playa could use just a little more live music... that wasn't dub step. Playing tunes from James Brown to The Temptations, Sly and The Family Stone to Kool And The Gang...and even some Stevie Wonder and the Four Tops.

Come groove, get your boogie down, and meditate to the beats of the fro… just make sure to take off your fucking shoes. If you are a singer or musician (horn player, guitarist, keys, etc) - come join the show. We've got a backing band and all the gear (unless that is you play horns) - so come say hi anytime during the week or just show up for the party.

we bring some soul to BRC with the SOULPLEX, a live music venue and groove factory.

title: The Tea House as Community Artform
description: Presented by Annie Oak.  The Saraswati Tea House was launched at Burning Man 2011 as a place for guests to rest, rehydrate and participate in the Chinese Gong Fu tea ritual. It's creators continued this project off the playa where it evolved into the Full Circle Tea House and continues to serve at many festivals and gatherings - including the 2012 Burn. This talk will describe how this model of community tea service can be used to provide compassionate hospitality at events where there are often too few friendly spaces that offer water, warm tea, quiet conversation, grounding ritual and a place to nap.
print_description: Presented by Annie Oak. This talk will describe how community tea service can provide grounding ritual and "compassionate hospitality" at events.

title: The Unified Field Theory and Beyond
description: Presented by Jamie Janover.  Learn about Nassim Haramein’s lifelong journey into the geometry of space-time, which has lead to a coherent understanding of the fundamental structure and dynamics of the universe and our existence in it. In this presentation, Jamie Janover will take you on a journey through humanity’s evolution, exposing the changes necessary to produce a Unified Physics; a unification of not only the forces of nature but also the occurrence of consciousness, one which also reveals emerging parallels between ancient codes left in documents and monuments with the most modern day advanced scientific ideas. This all-encompassing theory may prove to be one of the most important discoveries of our time.
print_description: Jamie Janover will take you on a journey through humanity’s evolution, exposing the changes necessary to produce a Unified Physics.

title: The Willingness to Open
description:
Come experience the liberating intimacy of presence exercises combined
with transparent communication creating a safe space of intensity that
will allow participants to become aware and explore shadow elements in
the personality. These shadows are unconscious elements that are
preventing greater intimacy in relationships and affecting all aspects
of life. Shadows can create an inability to be fully Authentic with
people. Two major symptoms of shadow elements are both Anxiety and
Depression. Shadow Work addresses the real underlying causes instead
of the symptoms that manifest. Most often it is an uncomfortableness
with vulnerability occurring during development that created an
unconscious shielding and protecting of the Heart. This workshop will
give the awareness practices to become aware of Shadow Elements and
inspiration to integrate them. The benefits of this work if done with
a Willingness to Open is a richer fuller life.
print_description:
Come experience the liberating intimacy of presence exercises combined
with transparent communication creating a safe space of intensity

title: THRIVE Screening/Dialogue with Foster Gamble
description:
In our 60ft dome, THRIVE creator Foster Gamble will screen his revolutionary film and host an inspired dialogue after the screening.

THRIVE is an unconventional documentary that lifts the veil on what's REALLY going on in our world by following the money upstream -- uncovering the global consolidation of power in nearly every aspect of our lives. Weaving together breakthroughs in science, consciousness and activism, THRIVE offers real solutions, empowering us with unprecedented and bold strategies for reclaiming our lives and our future.

INTERVIEWS in THRIVE
Duane Elgin, Nassim Haramein, Steven Greer, Jack Kasher, Daniel Sheehan, Adam Trombly, Brian O'Leary, Vandana Shiva, John Gatto, Deepak Chopra, David Icke, Catherine Austin Fitts, G. Edward Griffin, Bill Still, John Perkins, Aqeela Sherrills, Evon Peter, Angel Kyodo Williams, Elisabet Sahtouris, Amy Goodman, and Barbara Marx Hubbard.
print_description: In our 60ft. dome, THRIVE creator Foster Gamble will screen his revolutionary film on the big screen and host an inspired dialogue afterwards.

title: Tickling 101
description:
We learn tickling as a form of play and a form of connection. With us you will take it to the next level as a form of sensation play or even a bit of dominance and submission with your partner. Where you take it is up to you. The class is taught by men and women who have been involved in the tickling community for several years.

It is best to bring a partner to play with and something comfortable to lay upon. We will provide some basic tickling instruments and a bit of rope if you want to bind your partners wrists during the exercise (optional). If you don't have a partner you may still attend and listen or we might match you up. Due to possible space limitations we may give preference to those with a partner first.

Volunteers are also welcome for our demos. This is an audience participation so be prepared to laugh, giggle, snort, chortle, etc.

Although tickling is not always in an adult setting due to the nature of the talk and our interaction we ask that all participants and observers be at least 18 years of age. All genders and orientations are welcome to attend and volunteer.

You will learn some new techniques to enhance sensual play with other people and we will teach you some ticklish locations you may not have been aware of.

If the class is interested we can go into more of a deeper talk about the power exchange aspect of tickling.

Come visit us and have fun. We'll likely either be in the large dome or under shelter at Otis Spankmore. We will post sign(s) to help direct you to the class.
print_description: Learn the sensation play of tickling. Bring a partner and something to lay on. No partner? We’ll match you if we can. 18+ only. All genders welcome.

title: Tower of Nowhere Day of Celebration
description: After the night of the ritual and theatre of the live bell casting - in an atmosphere filled with chaos and fervour, anticipation and ritual, and a mesmerising display of traditional craftsmanship, and the grand finale of the crucible being lifted out of the fiery furnace and the blazing phosphorescent bronze liquid glowing as it is poured into the bell mould - let us descend on a day of contemplation and celebration!For one day only, the Tower of Nowhere becomes an empty canvas - just like the once unoccupied plains of the Black Rock Desert - here, for you to paint on. Ring the bell, meditate, find your inner peace, perform a ritual, get married, host a tea party or simply read the beautiful messages on the flags which were created by the UK and Nowhere Burner communities.If you have an event you'd like to host, please get in touch.
print_description: For one day only, the Tower of Nowhere becomes an empty stage; ring the bell, meditate, get married, have a tea party, read messages on the bunting...

title: Tower of Nowhere Live Bell Casting
description:
This year, the UK Regional Burning Man Community is to create one of the largest collaborative art projects from this side of the pond. 

The 'Tower of Nowhere' is a 20-foot bell tower, and a physical manifestation of our virtual community. It represents our hopes, dreams, memories, life and death and eventually rebirth. The tower will be planned in the UK, and built from scratch in the Black Rock Desert.

The bell founding takes place on the Tuesday night, beside the Tower of Nowhere on the Playa. We will cast five bells, a large central one which hangs as the centrepiece and four others encircling this, hung on each support.

The bell casting is surrounded by ritual and theatre, with people being invited to gift jewellery (copper, brass, bronze, tin, zinc, gold, silver but not steel, titanium etc) to the molten metal, in order to become a part of the bells themselves. 

Imagine the atmosphere filled with chaos and fervour, anticipation and ritual, and a mesmerising display of traditional craftsmanship!

The grand finale sees the great reveal, as the crucible is lifted out of the fiery furnace, the blazing phosphorescent bronze liquid and glowing as it is poured into the bell mould.
print_description: Live bell casting at the Tower of Nowhere. A mesmerising performance choreographed by alchemists. Bring small metallic gifts for this spiritual ritual

title: Transmedia to Transbeing
description: Presented by Mitch Schultz.  Through direct exploration of personal, cultural, and planetary myths, we seek to hack the source code of reality, redirecting the flow of images, symbols, narrative, and memes to construct a new mythology. We unravel the essence of life through our interactions with energy, nature, language, and myth. Explore the edges of reality and build open source code for a planetary rebirth.
print_description: Join Mitch Schultz to explore the edges of reality and build open source code for a planetary rebirth.

title: Trans Tea Time With Dean & Diane
description:
Meet other fabulous trans folks and allies for a cup of awesome iced tea at Trans Tea Time.  Let's talk about our
trans experiences on and off the playa and play party games.  Feel free to bring poetry, stories, questions, song, theatrics, and things that represent you. All genders welcome always! This will be a safe and fun space. Plus Dean and Diane are fierce, fine, and fabulous...and we know you are too!
print_description: Fabulous trans folks & allies come gather for ice tea, convo, & games. Safe space to talk about trans experiences on & off playa. All genders welcome!

title: Traveling Shangri-Lounge
description: Our newest project will be an amazing little bike trailer that will travel to a new location a few nights during the week and provide tables, chairs and fine drinks. Come relax with a martini and the soothing sounds of Frank Sinatra and cool jazz. Look for the neon martini glass. A wonderful atmosphere to bring your new or old playa friends to relax and share a special moment with each other, out there in the deep playa. You just have to find us... Please make sure to have your ID ready - you have to be twenty one (21) years old to drink @ our Traveling ShangriLa Lounge - Blessings.
print_description: Come relax with a martini and the soothing sounds of Frank Sinatra and cool jazz. Look for the neon martini glass...

title: Travis Pope
description:
From Deep Dubby Downtempo, to the Chill Side of Breaks, Funky Bass Grooves,Whomp-Heart-Centered Dub-Step, World Beat...Crazy Silly Mash-ups and more.... 

A DJ who first connected with electronic music 15 years ago and immediately become obsessed with the manifestations of new sounds, spaces and vibrations. 

I began with a MC-303, and a drive and commitment to create a unique style of soulful conscious and uplifting music. This over all vision has manifested into many different styles and genres and I now play quite an eclectic mix.
print_description: From Deep Dubby Downtempo, to the Chill Side of Breaks, Funky Bass Grooves,Whomp-Heart-Centered Dub-Step, World Beat...Crazy Silly Mash-ups & more...

title: Tribe - A 5Rhythms Workshop w/Amber Ryan
description:
In this creative 5Rhythms exploration we will move from surface to essence, from our individual stories towards the artistry of being an empowered creative force in harmony with the whole.  We will physically explore the concepts of community and  holding space for ourselves and others. Together, we will cultivate an inner and outer listening which will invite us into a place beyond words where instinct and intuition reign. 

The 5Rhythms “tribal work” is a practice where we cultivate the ability to be good leaders and a powerful part of a the collective.  In this 2 hour workshop we will artistically expand our capacity towards the kind of freedom that allows our own personal expressions to live and thrive in harmonious vibration with the whole.  We will dance, sweat and pray for the possibility to arrive into the breath-full, blissful meditative beat of the One.
print_description: The 5Rhythms “tribal work” is a dance practice where we cultivate the ability to be good leaders and a powerful part of a the collective.

title: Tribe Talks
description: TribeTalks is a dynamic venue that enables participants to offer wisdom offerings to the community within a casual, cafe-like environment. Each talk is offered within 3-10 minutes, providing a efficient way to share and enable co-creation and connections. No powerpoint presentations or projections. A dedicated team of partners host, organize, gather information, film, catalog, and share the presentations to our online networks for further co-creation opportunit. The vision is to build a living, open, online forum and resource for participants to have their voices heard and visions seen by our global human family!http://www.youtube.com/TribeTalksOffered and coordinated by Bridgewalkers and The Convergence Networkhttp://www.bridgewalkers.comhttp://theconvergencenetwork.org/
print_description: TribeTalks is an open forum for participants to offer 3-10 min talks to the community on a wide range of subjects.  Come and be inspired!

description: Tye the Guy (Dfind) entered hip hop through poetry and with a background in theater. Never gangster, thug or caught with mainstream aspirations, his pieces reflect lateral, complex thinking on beats just as intricate.

title: Ultimate Flavor Tripping: Sweet or Tart?
description: Give your mind a rest and let your tongue trip out. Explore the wide world of temporary flavor transformation! Not only will we have Miracle Fruit, blocking your tongue's sour/bitter receptors so that sour tastes sweet and lemons taste like candy -- but for the first time, we will also be bringing Gymnema, a plant which does precisely the reverse, muting the sweet flavor of foods. So come, sample our wares (before they run out!) and explore your Sweet and Tart sides.
print_description: Give your mind a rest and let your tongue trip out. Explore Miracle Fruit- turning sour into sweet, and Gymnema- muting sweet flavors of foods.

title: UNICORN RAMPAGE 2012
description: CALLING ALL UNICORNS!!! *other magical beings welcome* Come dance the night away with Charlie the Unicorn and a fleet of art cars. This is the official Unicorn Stampede After Party. So grab your horns, head to the trash fence and spend the night with us! Featuring: DJ Dan, Dave Carvahlo, divaDanielle, Fleewtwood Smack, The Fuzz, Erik Nelson and Jen Woolfe. Plus, EPIC SUNRISE SET WITH PUMPKIN!

title: Unicorns Invade the Castle
description: Join the Camp Charlie Unicorn Brigade and help storm the Mystikal Misfit's keep as we dance to a world of rainbow flavored beats and drink delicious libations in the dark dungeons of Contraception Castle.  DivaDanielle, Fleetwood Smack, and The Fuzz will be turning the tables, so wear your playa finest as we party in your medieval fantasy come to life.  As always, expect the unexpected.
print_description: Join the Camp Charlie Unicorn Brigade and help storm the Mystikal Misfit's Castle!  Rainbow flavored beats and delicious libations provided. 21+ w/ID

title: Unicorn Stampede
description:
Every year the Unicorns come from the Enchanted Forest to play at Burningman. We bring magick and innocence to the playa and we fart butterflies and poop rainbows.

There is a rumor that we eat bunnies, and it is true, but only with their consent. They like it. It tickles. Then they turn into candy.

In the Enchanted Forest we are always having big lovely orgies with our friends. We like orgies, and we are always horny!! At burningman we are having a stampede, taking our unbridled joy and annoyingly perky enthusiasm across the playa.

Join us! We will be galloping around making a nuisance of ourselves, stampeding through people's camps spreading our intolerably positive energy throughout the festival.

We will start at 6.30pm, and then stampede around who knows where as the sun sets. We will provide horns to those who are horn deficient. We really can't wait to meet you! Squeeeee!
print_description: The Unicorns are so intolerably perky & enthusiastic we just can't keep it in. We're farting butterflies in excitement. Stampede with us.
other_location: We start between the Man and Center Camp

title: Universal Truths with Dr. Michael Beckwith
description: The inspired founder of Agape, Michael Beckwith shares universal truth principles found in the New Thought-Ancient Wisdom tradition of spirituality.Dr. Michael Beckwith’s life is a living testament to building spiritual community. In the 1970’s he began an inward journey into the teachings of East and West, and today teaches universal truth principles found in the New Thought-Ancient Wisdom tradition of spirituality. Gifted with a vision of a trans-denominational spiritual community, in 1986 he founded the Agape International Spiritual Center upon his faith in that original vision and is co-founder of the Association for Global Thought, an organization dedicated to planetary healing and transformation.
print_description: The inspired founder of Agape, Michael Beckwith shares universal truth principles found in the New Thought-Ancient Wisdom tradition of spirituality.

title: Vision Quest Roulette
description:
Vision Quest Roulette is 3 wheels: Spin two for your destination (Let's say you get 5:30 and C street) then spin the big one for a Vision Quest (like... Start a game of Tag with strangers!) Now your job is to go there and DO IT! ---------------------------
Some quests are more challenging, like "Give away something very precious to you, accept nothing in return" and some leave your fate to chance... "Find the quiet man in the hat, tell him you are on a Vision Quest, ask him what to do next." ----------> Every quest has you interact with your fellow BRC citizens and step a little out of your comfort zone. -----------------> Spinning the wheels is a great way to see new things, meet new people, and maybe stumble onto a playa lesson or two. -----> Warning: Only spin the wheels if you plan on doing a quest before the end of the Burn... Our resident hippies have put weird hippy magic into the wheels... quests ignored may have unknown consequences... ------------------------ Right across from Center Camp at Blackrock Yearbook (Inner Circle and 4:44) Get your photo taken by the Yearbook while you are there!

title: Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul
description:
Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul in connection with your breath and movement during this yoga class. Be inspired and take your body to a higher self-awareness by joining me in a traditional Kundalini Yoga warm-up and introductory set/kriya. If you are already experienced in yoga, you can incorporate longer time and more intense movement into the exercises, and benefit from realizing and stretching the boundaries of your physical abilities. 
Come to this class at least 90 minutes after eating a meal, in comfortable clothing that will allow for a full range of movement. Bring a healthy snack with you to enjoy after the class. Bring a water bottle you can fill it at the Pink Heart water bar, or your own favorite hydration to enjoy during the class. Yoga mat not necessary, but recommended.
print_description: Warm up your heart and activate your body and soul in connection with your breath and movement during this yoga class.

title: What are those 5Rhythms Anyway? w/Spinnaker
description: Want to know more about Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms movement practice? Join RhythmWave's Spinnaker (aka Cynthia Kennedy from Olympia Washington) to this 2 hour class and be gently guided through each of the rhythms: flowing, staccato, chaos, lyrical and stillness. Each rhythm focuses on a simple movement quality rather than a specific form or set of steps, giving everyone the freedom to move in ways that feel authentic without any pressure to get it right. With a little instruction, the experience of the 5Rhythms opens us deeply and helps us move beyond self-consciousness to an authentic connection to our body and life force. Using the discipline of each rhythm and the breath as a catalyst for movement, you will be invited to embody, follow, express, and release your own energy. In the end, you will find yourself renewed and reconnected to your own self, feeling fully alive.
print_description: Want to know more about Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms movement practice? Come to this gently guided class through each of the rhythms of ecstatic dance

title: WhyTheNose Wednesday
description:
My name is Tex Allen and I wear a clown nose 90% of the time I'm outside of my home. Whythenose.com is dedicated to the act of wearing a clown nose everyday, in order to make people smile.

It’s here for YOU…to encourage you with an act of Heroic Uninhibited Innocence.
It’s really that simple. In a world filled with distractions and distrust, you’d be amazed at how many people have lost a sense of childlike wonder. Or maybe you wouldn’t…

In the year since WhyTheNose was launched on the Playa at Rites of Passage, the project has transformed not only me, but it's brought together thousands of people through the photos and videos I've created.

Wearing a clown nose is fun, it’s easy, and it’s free if you already have the nose. YOU CAN COME GRAB ONE AT CENTER CAMP CAFE AND OTHER LOCATIONS ALL WEEK AT BRC...I'm bringing 5000 :)

WhyTheNose is only here to show you how joyful it is to change someone’s day with a simple, silly act.
Trust me, the nose breaks through barriers and opens doors every time you wear it…give it a try!

When you wear it and you’re waiting with a kind word, a laugh, a validation that you’re NOT crazy, just happy?
MAN, that’s powerful powerful stuff!

Ultimately, one’s attitude, your inner light, your reason raison d’etre that can make a difference in people’s lives and it’s a simple as the nose on your face.

Be loving and see what happens!

The inclusion of the nose is what creates the dissonance and that slight shift in “reality” is very important..it can (gently) jar people enough to open that door, that opportunity in them for opening up and taking a chance, taking a little risk to interact with someone they don’t know..who has on a clown nose!?!

Find WhyTheNose at Center Camp Cafe all week and if you pick up a Nose, would you please wear it Wednesday? I want YOU to help me spread the joy and beauty and ethos of OUR community with this one act you take take home and use every day :)

Thank's for the love, sfTex
print_description: WhyTheNose Wednesday is a day dedicated to wearing a clown nose, just because it's fun! Free Noses will be available all week at Center Camp Cafe!

title: Why Visionary Art Matters
description: Presented by Alex and Allyson Grey.  The most healing and life affirming event a person can have is the visionary mystical experience. There are proven and reliable methods of accessing mystical states through psychedelics. A new kind of sacred art is emerging from those who have imbibed the sacrament, journeyed to the inner heavens and then brought their revelations back to share with the community through works of art. Learn seven ways that visionary art matters and how art evolves consciousness in this illustrated exploration of visionary art.

title: WITNESS EVOLUTION!!
description: All of human life on earth can be divided between ignorance of metal (the Stone Age) and the mastery of it: the Bronze Age, when arrows got tips, cookware was no longer mere pottery, and the door opened to the alchemy of advanced human invention because we were no longer limited to constructing in wood and earthenware.  You cannot NOT watch metal liquify.  It is entrancing to any human being.  The stirring of our glowing orange pot represents the cosmic brew whence we all sprang.  Come contemplate this fermentation of civilization as we prepare for the artistic creations possible only when you ignite the Amanda Radar Range of 3,000 B.C.Mold Making: Thursday, 30th 10 AMBig Casting: Friday,31st, 5-8 PM
print_description: Not the biological kind!  The metalurgical kind! Come watch us create a witches brew of liquid metal!  We will do a molten "pour" in your presence!

title: Wobble tha' ~WaVe~2.0 w/Tsunami Bass Experience!!
description:
As always, Morphous & ShiZaru and the full international and domestic TBE crew are oh so ready, willing and able to facilitate the very best in bassquakin' as loud & proud as needed, to generate a veritble TSUNAMI deluge of freeBASSin' for all the denizens of Black Rock City. 

In addition to the high quality audio ~WaVeS~ TBE is well known for in their event enhancement production, once again TBE will be bringing their official theme camp (the TSUNAMI BASS EXPERIENCE), which will serve as the location for TBE's multi-media, interactive art/sound installation: the ~WaVe~2.0 to BRC!

This revolutionary interactive installation was conceived, designed and created by ShiZaru.zoe & Andrew Morphous specifically for the application of BASS CULTURE APPRECIATION and EDUTAINMENT. The first ~WaVe~ Ver. 1 prototype debuted in NYC in Feb 2011 at the Funhaus technology fair with subsequent indoor, outdoor and mobile versions appearing at various art and bass culture events during the spring and summer throughout in the NYC area including the LOST HORIZONS NIGHT MARKET and the FIGMENT NYC 2011 and 2012 art festival on Governor's Island. 
If you have had the TSUNAMI BASS EXPERIENCE, then you know how it LOOKS, SOUNDS, and FEELS... 

The ~WaVe~ installation is capable of transducing the low end frequencies as low as 5 Hz, provides a sensory enhancement oft described as a "bassface inducing," but more importantly, taps directly into one's kinestetic learning/thinking modality. It is this, when combined with the proper audio and visual ~WaVeS~ for expontential enahancement, that sparks the intuitive, thereby facilitating proper BASS CULTURE APPRECIATION. 

So come on by and take a dip in the deluge, challenge your perceptions on the Tsunami Bass Experience's ~WaVe~2.0, custom built 'Body~Sonic' dance platforms that will rumble ur rectum and sooth your heart/mind with oh so fine low end frequency via proper BASS!!
print_description: Challenge your perceptions on TBE's custom Body-Sonic ~WaVe~ installation, an experience that allows you to intuit proper bass culture like no other!

description:
After a year away, Wordsmithing returns to the playa. With improvements! Most notably, you'll be able to take a copy of your word with you this time, so you can put it to use.
Stop by Camp Tsunami in the afternoons, and while you're getting some body paint, playa fashion makeovers, or visiting our Inconvenience Store, let Beef Pies lovingly hand-craft for you your very own brand-new word! Your participation is to give your word meaning--a definition!
I'll also be giving words to random Burners as I wander about the playa. You could be a target for random Wordsmithing!

title: WoW Addicts Recovery Meeting
description:
Wait, we have to go a whole week without logging in to play computer games? Better believe by Saturday there’s a lot of us going to be jonesing for our fix. That doesn’t just apply to those of us in camp, there’s thousands of people out on the playa that will be getting the mouse-hand shakes by the weekend. Since popping up the laptop and logging on isn’t an option, we’ll just have ourselves an addiction party instead.

Open to all everyone, gamer or not, we’ll have a little gathering Saturday afternoon. Anyone who has completed our daily quests, or just wants to hang out and get their fix is welcome. Our resident mad alchemist has come up with some special brews, and servings of delicious chocolate cake are available to all. If any of our "Dragonbreath" chili remains, it’s a great time to polish that off. Hang out, drink some "kungaloosh", take down a "sulfuron slammer", and swap war stories of "How I wiped the 40 man raid".
print_description: Miss raiding?  Want to talk about your DPS?  Come discuss, and have some delicious chocolate cake!

title: Yoga with Uma
description:
Indulge in this challenging, informative, spontaneous, and worshipful experience with Uma, celebrated by New York Magazine as one of NYC's top 5 fitness gurus. Open to all levels.
 
About Uma
 
A life-long belief of "to know it is to live it" found Uma at the doorstep of the famed NYC Jivamukti Yoga Studio of Sharon Gannon and David life. 1997's top grad turned teacher-training director, began to cultivate her roots. Saraswati's "serial chants" and "deft sermons" quickly soared globally as both U.S. and French edition Marie Claire magazines began to pick up on her message.
 
As the foremost Senior Advanced Certified Jivamukti Yoga Teacher, Saraswati mentored hundreds of students. Devotees and apprentices have gone on to open successful yoga studios nationwide.
 
Spiritual master, Shree Maa, initiated Uma into the ceremonial rites of puja worship. Her name Nanda Saraswati, The Goddess of Bliss, was then bestowed.
 
Through intense workshops and rehabilitative knowledge, Uma teaches the authentic experience of becoming your Self. In her pocket she carries a toolkit of ancient teachings: knowledge of Sanskrit language, performance of ceremonial worship, kirtan chanting (5-year tour with famed wallah bhagavan das), meditation, bhakti, and karma yoga studies. Over the years, Uma has had a host of long-standing, high profile, private clients.
 
Uma’s belief that you can't read life, you have to become life; moves you into the depths of your being, so you can peace out. 
 
When she is not teaching yoga in downtown NYC, she is ecstatically chanting the name of God in bliss-filled, rock the house, get up and dance kirtans with Lokah. Their debut album, The Ivy Ceiling, is a groundbreaking work that fuses their hearts, souls and voices in a collage of sound.  The album features the vocal gracings of Sting and a spoken word introduction by Russell Simmons.  Roderick and Anissa Romero of the Seattle underground band, Sky Cries Mary, are featured on backing vocals.
print_description: Indulge in this challenging, informative,& worshipful experience with Uma, named by New York Magazine as one of NYC's top 5 fitness gurus. Open to all

title: You're The Limit Stage
description:
Camp Above The Limit is hosting an open mic Musicians' Happy Hour Monday thru Thursday from 4:00 pm till 8:00 pm with a grand performance on Saturday. 
We will have scheduled and ad hoc performances promoting musical diversity, radical self expression, participation, and entertainment. 

If you are a musician or performance artist and wish to play on the "You're The Limit Stage" bring yourself, your talent and your instrument to Camp Above The Limit and participate in our Musical Diversity Program! It doesn't matter what it is! From violin to kazoo, guitar to ocarina, banjo, sarod, sitar, Spanish bagpipes, heck even accordions are welcome. 

Bluegrass, Shamanic, Old Timey, Country, Rock, Classical, Irish, English, Morris Dancing, French, Middle Eastern, Balkan, Afghan, Indian, Barber Shop, or performance art. Whether it be your whole band or your radically self-expressive solo act, bring it! We will provide sound and we'll have other musicians for accompaniment: drums, guitar, mandolin, most likely anything you would need. We will be putting together an all-star performance on Saturday for all those who participate so come be a part of a great community of musicians and performance artists and share your gifts with us and the playa! Community is what makes the Burn so great and within all communities there is greatness! Come share yours with all of us!
print_description: Musicians' Happy Hour! Open mic, scheduled and ad hoc performances promoting musical diversity, radical self expression, and great entertainment!
